1.content:
Gunner's Butte Colorado was not the most liveliest town even before the global pandemic had hit. Situated in the foothills of the Colorado Plateau, it's main draw was North Point University, which like everything else, was suffering under the strict lock-down and quarantine that had gripped the entire planet and human civilization as a whole. Most of the student body and faculty had been sent home save for a handful of students that simply were too poor or were unable to go home because of the restricted international travel. The handful of students left had initially looked forward to having no classes and taking full advantage of the nearby campus strip and it's bevy of stores, night clubs and bars...Only to find that like everything else, those too had been shuttered save for a handful of 'essential' stores in the nearby mall.

It was a dreary life in the high desert, as the college that was known for being more of a 'party' college was reduced to anything but. With nothing to do, nowhere to go and bored out of their minds, the stranded students could do little but sit around in their dorms and wait for something to happen. And for the four students that currently inhabited the Oak Hall dorms, something was indeed happening.

"What kind of a name is 'the Third Wish'?" Peter Tzimeros grunted as he settled down on the worn out couch of the dorm's common room. the football player wasn't used to playing complicated board games like the one in front of him. He'd only ever played games like Sorry! or other simple games as a kid..But there was only so many times he could watch old replays of sports on TV now that everything had shut down and had left him stranded, his parents having been in Greece visiting his grandparents when everything had gone to hell. Still, he could have done a lot worse and been stuck with a bunch of jerks instead of his girlfriend and two cool (for dorks) freshman kids.

"A cool name! Y'know, like with the genie and stuff? Aladdin? Ugh I LOVE that movie! We should watch it later!" Lindsey Michaels chittered as she bounced into her bean bag that she had hauled down from her new room on the fifth floor. Despite her usually 'bimbo blonde' looks, the currently rainbow haired ex-sorority girl was currently taking a break from her IT course, one of the few classes that hadn't slammed to a sudden stop. But she HAD been affected, her Gamma Upsilon Rho Lambda (GURL) sorority house closing down and forcing her to move into Oak Hall. But the Freshman had remained chipper about it, and the fact that with her barista job gone she lacked the funds (or desire) to move back home to Seattle.

"The technical term is Djinn, actually. And I second Aladdin, but only the live action one because it's more historically accurate. But yeah, sounds cool! Maybe we could check it out later? You said it's like a off-brand Hot topic, or something, right Eugene?" Judy Ross said, the top-heavy, purple haired goth said as she walked across the room with a bowl of popcorn and settled onto the couch beside Peter. Judy was majoring in mythology, and despite her punkish exterior was actually quite sweet. She was, in her own words, 'just going through a phase', and she had refused to go home, citing 'lifestyle choices' with her heavily conservative parents. She was Peter's girlfriend, the two somehow coming together across the vast social divide of 'arts nerd' and 'scholorship jock' to end up as freshman sweethearts last year.

And Eugene, the all-american freshman geek on campus, blushed at the attention. The slightly overweight 18 year old had stumbled onto the strange store on his way back from a solo outing to the otherwise deserted Plateau Heights mall on the near side of town. Stranded when his flight back to California was cancelled and without a car and unwilling to put the burden of his already struggling mom, Eugene had been lucky enough to get on the list to stay at the dorms. Besides, he sort of liked having all this time to hang out with Lindsey. She was into computers, and he loved playing video games on computers and they had a lot of geeky stuff to talk about...

"Yeah" Eugene replied as he pulled one of the lounge chairs over to the wide table that his recent purchase sat upon, "It was cool but...Really weird? You guys remember that old store called Spencer's?" A trio of shaking heads forced him to re-gather his thoughts, "Well, it was this old store that used to sell all kinds of weird shit. Like they had a bunch of geeky stuff that you and I would like, Lindsey"

"Oooh, like what?" The girl cooed as she reached over and grabbed a handful of popcorn from the large bowl that currently rested on Judy's fishnet-clad knees.

"Well, everything. Like movie props and video games and jewelry...They even had like costumes and anime and normal clothes. Well, normal for Judy"

"Hey" The goth chimed in through her own mouthful of popcorn.

"Sorry. But yeah they even had like, dildos and fleshlights in the back, right? So the Third Wish was a lot like that only without the sex toys or the blacklights and loud music. It was kind of like a counter-culture antique store? They had a LOT of 80s and 90s stuff in there. Anyway it's like the only store in the mall that isn't closed right? So I go in and it's empty, I don't even see anyone at the front desk and I think maybe it's closed and they just forgot to lock up or something...But then BOOM this girl pops up behind me! And she goes something like, 'Hey, do you need any help finding anything today?' And I, you know, tell her no, but then she goes off, grabs this thing and brings it right back to me!"

"That sounds a little creepy, Geno" Peter said as he draped a muscled arm around Judy, who snuggled in closer, her eyes wide with interest.

"Well that's what I thought too! But then she starts talking about this game and I'm not gonna lie I started geeking out a little bit because of all it can do! Here, let me read you the rules..." Eugene reached down and picked up the empty shell the game had come in and began reading off the text that was printed on the back of the weathered cardboard.

"This is a game that you will find, brings excitement in boring times. Comes with infinite games that come with two modes, each with it's own rules. We can play it like a traditional board game or we can play something it's calling 'Immersive Mode', which if I'm understanding this right, is sort of like playing Dungeons and Dragons?"

"Uh, I don't know how to play that" Peter said with a frown.

"Yeah, me neither" Judy said as she set the popcorn bowl on the table next to the hub-capped shaped game.

"Oh! I do! But I've only played once. I was a gnome! I stabbed some guys in the legs and stole their treasure. It was cool but the guys never invited me back to play again" Lindsey said, and Eugene tried not to just start nerding out over that fact. "But umm, like, where's the board? Or the little action figures? You need those to play either, right?"

"Actually no, the game is all in there!" Eugene said, pointing at the game, which to him looked like an old 1980's prototype game console, "It's like a computer, we turn it on, and then we slide a keyboard out from that latch on the side and type in WHATEVER we wnat as a game! We can make it as long or short as we want, and it has four pre-installed game modes but we can program it to make whatever we want! It even has a little printer for the game map and see that little black box on the side? I can even program in MORE with my computer!"

"Woah! Dude, this must have set you WAY back" Judy said, leaning up off the couch to inspect the game more closely.

"Actually I only spent like fifteen bucks!" The girl was way nice, she said she knew what it was like to be cooped up with nothing to do for a long time"

"Woah!"

"Yeah, I know right? But yeah, it also has little cards it'll dispense if we play traditional, like Monopoly cards or something to 'add challenge' to the game. We use one dice, singles and double rolls get two turns and high rollers have to always draw a card...And there's little action spaces that are a lot like the cards. I guess it's all there to make the game more interesting? Anyway, whoever gets to the middle has to yell 'Morphmanji!' and they 'get a wish', whatever that means. With immersive mode it sort of sounds like we have to RP our characters through the game and complete the quest, we get five lives but if we use up all of them we can't play with them anymore...But whoever wins has to yell the same thing and get a wish like Traditional. There's something on here about how if players leave the game before it's finished that can't play again...And this thing must be really old, most of the print is rubbed off here" Eugene said as he squinted at the faded text as it trailed off. "Oh well, how hard could it be, right?"

"You know, this kinda reminds me of an old movie..." Lindsey said, leaning back in her bean-bag, "But maybe I'm just having a blonde moment. Who made it?"

"I don't know, there's no logo on it" Eugene said, looking at the box and then around the game.

"Well if we're going to do this, let's do it already!" Peter said with a yawn, "I like you guys but this geeky stuff just makes me even more bored"

"Yeah, let's play!" Lindsey seconded.

"Okay...Just press this button here..." Eugene said, pushing on the Big Red Button in the middle of the console's top. There was a series of synthetic beeps and boops, and with a metallic click an old mechanical keyboard slid out of the base of the machine.

"PLEASE INPUT GAME TYPE" A robotic voice squawked from a speaker near the power button.

"This is so cool!" Lindsey squealed.

"Okay guys, what do we want to play first?" Eugene asked as he positioned his hands above the keyboard.

After a moment. the group decided on...
1.title: Morphanji: The Roll of the Dice...

11.content:
"PLEASE INPUT GAME TYPE" The strange mechanical game buzzed from it's tiny speaker. The group of friends looked at each other.

"Oh great, more talking" Peter said dismissively. He was on the verge of just not playing with all the talk. And besides, it seemed a little complicated for his tastes anyway. But Judy was clearly interested so maybe he'd just stick with it. But damn, this was a lot of talking for a game! He was used to just loading up Madden or something in his Xbox and getting into the game immediately.

"Oh hush. It's old" Judy said, "It's not like your football game"

"Yeah, you just gotta give it time and junk" Lindsey nodded, backing up her friend.

"Well, what do we want to play? It comes pre-loaded with Adventure, Mystery, Military, Historical and...Random" Eugene said, reading of the text on the game's box, "It has different scenarios for each one. We can play those before we start creating our own game types. What do you guys want to play first?"

"It's your game Gene, you pick!" Judy suggested.

"Yeah!" Lindsey chimed in.

Eugene blushed, "No, I-I want us all to decide. We're a team"

"Adventure, definitely. If I'm gonna be playing some weird game then I wanna just go balls out crazy with it" Peter said, leaning forward after a moment of awkward silence.

"Ugh, gross" Judy said with a dramatic roll of her eyes, "Do you always have to bring up your junk in a conversation?"

"I didn't hear you complaining in the middle of our...debate last night" Peter said as he darted in, planting a big kiss on his girlfriend's lips.

Eugene coughed on a bit of spit as Lindsey giggled uncontrollably.

"So, bleh, anyway, are we good with adventure?" The freshman said once the four of them had recovered from the moment. Three other heads nodded in unison.

"Okay, adventure mode it is!" Eugene leaned over and carefully typed the word 'Adventure' on the small keyboard, taking his time to not spell it wrong or accidentally break the rather fragile looking keyboard. When he was done he pressed enter, and the machine made a clicking sound before mechanically intoned....

"GAME TYPE: ADVENTURE. PLEASE CHOOSE GENRE"

"So what do we want to play guys?" Eugene said, pulling up the box that seemed to have an near endless amount of detail crammed onto it, "We can pick from...

choices: "Arabia" Judy chipped in, already imagining herself as some Sultan's daughter...

111.content:
"I remember the statues and temples from Greece. As a kid they were scary." Peter confessed. "I loved the stories of Gods amongst us, and all the creatures. I kinda wish we could go there, experience it."

Eugene was nodding along, "Yeah... Like the adventure of Ulysses, as he battled the Cyclops, or Circe the witch, that'd be a great adventure."

"Greece sounds like fun." Judy interrupted, "But, the tales of Sheherazad, a woman telling stories so she was kept alive. I loved that one as a kid. To play in that world sounds like fun to me."

"Like I say the films with Aladdin or like Sinbad, with his bare rippling chest, and they were gorgeous and hunky. A real Man, who'd win the princess, and leave the harem girls swooning."

"Yeah, they all sound fun." Eugene tried to work the friends towards a common vision.

"So we want, fantasy creatures.... like Djinn, sorcerors, minotaurs and demons, harem girls, and heroic .. heroic heroes." he finished lamely, his voice trailing off.

"So..." Eugene started speaking again, his confidence coming back, as he read his friends faces.

"Where do we want to go?" he half-asked. As his friends looked from one face to another he continued.

"We could set it in Greece, the deserts of Arabia, in the jungles of Africa, tomb raiding, or on some other world..."

Sneaking in his own favourite as a compromise option. Eugene loved the Indiana Jones films... Well the first three, and was happy to compromise with a different world. His friends were more engaged with the idea nodding along, and compromising on each of the different features.

"So where do you think we should set it?" he asked.
111.title: Genre: Fantasy

choices: Looking indecisive, "Traditional?" Judy answered... or asked.
"I've already got my Princess." Peter said, as Lindsay giggled.
1111.content:
"I wanna see what the princess life is like...." She half-chuckled, looking at the ropey console.

Eugene wasn't sure what machine it was. It was an old console. Judy's dreamy expression suggested, she was already fantasizing about the Princess life. A pampered existence, waited on hand and foot, every whim satisfied, and ultimate authority coming from royal privilege.

Eugene was thinking the same thing, trying to decide if it was even 8-bit, 16-bit, or some hybrid machine. Guessing it was pre-playstation... playstation one, even. He agreed, his expectations were lowering with each minute. His logic was that Arabia would be easier to render, and he'd have to get used to lots of empty sandy vistas. Only an oasis here and there, and a temple half lost to the dunes would be enough for whatever processor was inside.

Lindsay and Peter were more interested in each other than the game. A disinterested, "Whatever..., sounds fine." Tells Eugene exactly how invested in the game they aren't.

With only himself and Judy seeming to be engaged, he selected 'Middle Eastern Adventure', hoping for djinn, magic, evil sorcerors and capricious sultans. He was more hyped to play it than he realised. If Judy got to be a princess, perhaps he could be the heroic Aladdin, or Sinbad. Hell, even the Sultan could be interesting. If he was the Sultan he'd certainly explore the harem, and keep his eye on any Vizier he had.

Hell, he knew they were the biggest risk of treachery or overthrow in the game, even without playing.

Toggling it back and forth between Traditional and Immersive, he asked Judy with his eyes which she preferred.

11111.content:
As Eugene selected 'Start Game', he was startled when the room around them vanished in an instant. Looking around he was in an opulent royal court. The walls high, impressively decorated, and the whole scene far more detailed and realistic than should've been possible. Even with a top of the line graphic card this level of realism was impossible.

His fingers felt empty, but he fumbled to manipulate the controller, even if he couldn't see it. There was no feedback, no sensation of anything in his hands.

"I'm... I'm a princess." The words snapped Eugene out of his reverie, and he looked up to the dias, and the thrones there.

He had to assume it was Judy, her eyelids fluttering shut, as she inhaled the rich perfume that suffused the air. Hell, even the atmosphere felt oppressive and hot.

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/24/f9/75/...

Judy's make-up and jewellery were expensive and time-consuming. Her chest slowly rising and falling, as if she were inhaling the entire experience.

"Judy?" you ask. Only to be startled by the softness of your voice.

Trying again, "Judy?" you ask again. This time it's impossible to mistake. Belatedly you take in your own game body. It's every inch as feminine as Judy's. Only the level of make-up and jewellery is less. Telling you clearly that you're no princess.

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/c8/b6/10/...

Catching your reflection in a silver plate, you see an incredible set of lips. Made for sucking cocks. You shudder, realising that now, you'll be the one on her knees, sucking away, rather than the guy being blown.

You hope the game isn't too 'realistic' about the roles of women in this game. Another belated thought lands, you don't know your objectives, the goal for this nightmare to end.

"Lindsay?" the princess asks. Your cheeks burn as you shake your head, having to confess, "Eugene..." in a choked voice.

Looking about, you hunt for Peter and Lindsay.

111111.content:
Eugene and Judy were walking through the shockingly enormous palace in search of Peter and Lindsay. They did pass a few people...if you could call them people. There were a number of women who were dressed similarly to Eugene who would simply bow to Judy and walk off while only muttering 'Princess' before they walked off. There were also men with swords standing in front of doors that not even a princess might be allowed in. As they walked along Eugene and Judy could swear they even saw the same woman and guard multiple times.

Eugene sighed to himself as he muttered, "Probably a memory limitation."

"Memory limitation? What do you mean by that?" Judy asked.

"Well, the fact that we're seeing the same model multiple times and the fact we probably can't enter all of these rooms is probably a memory limitation of that game. It's not truly an open and immersive world, it's a little disappointing."

"Seriously? We got...sucked into this world after you pushed a few buttons and you're complaining how it's not high tech enough?" Judy said exasperatedly.

"It's just an observation..." Eugene said shrinking a little under Judy's gaze. The two continued to walk along in silence until something caught their attention. Off in the distance the voice of a woman called out, "What the FUCK is going on here!"

Knowing they finally had a lead on their other friends Judy and Eugene sprinted towards the angry woman's voice and when they got in visual range they saw quite the sight. A beautiful woman was pacing back and forth in a fury. She was wearing a red harem outfit with layers of see through materials, she was also adorned with a jewels, not as nice as Judy's but eye catching never the less. But there was one piece of jewelry she had Judy didn't. A bronze collar with a chain attached to it, and at the end of the chain was a large man standing almost 7 feet tall with a large black beard and muscles that were easy to admire with since he was only wearing a loin cloth. But despite his impressive physique, he looked oddly scared. He said with a deep voice that did not convey the confidence one would expect, "Let's just stay here and, like, take a breather and figure stuff out."

"Figure stuff out? I don't want to figure anything out. I want to wake up from this freaky dream because that's the only logical explanation for what's happening!" The harem girl screamed at the giant man and she tried to walk off.

"No wait!" The man said as he tugged at the chain and sent the now coughing girl to the floor. "OHMYGAWD I'M SO SORRY! I just...I just don't know my own strength! Are you ok?"

By now Eugene and Judy had gotten to the two fighting and Judy helped the harem girl up and said, "This might sound like a weird question...but are you my boyfriend?"

The girl looked up at the princess and hugged her, "Judy!? Oh man I was afraid I'd never see you again!" Peter said, but as the hug went on and he felt his very large breasts mashed up again his girlfriends he backed off. "I mean, I had everything under control. I was just going to go off to find and save you, but the Hulk over here wouldn't let me." Peter glared at the giant man who looked like he was about to cry.

"I just didn't want to risk you getting hurt. You don't have the muscles you have in the real world and there are some scary looking people around." The manly Lindsay said eyeing some guards that were passing by.

"Oh yeah? Well maybe you could have used your muscles and go..." Peter said starting to get confrontational with Lindsay when Judy said, "ENOUGH!" Peter froze in his tracks under his girlfriend's command. Judy continued, "We don't need to fight each other. We're on the same side. We're playing this...crazy game and we should...just play it. And fighting isn't going to solve a damn thing."

"Yeah...yeah you're right." Peter said as he looked up to Lindsay, "I'm sorry." Peter simply said. Judy sighed, her boyfriend was good about apologizing when he knew he was wrong, but wasn't really good with his words.

"I'm sorry too." Lindsay said wiping the last of the tears from her eyes and she looked at Judy and Eugene. "You both also look so beautiful, I'm jealous."

"Uh, thanks." Eugene said while blushing. He'd never expected to be told by his crush that she was jealous of his looks. Then again he also never expected to be immersed in an Arabian game world where he was some sort of hand maiden so it was a day full of surprises. Eugene shook his head to get focused, "We've all found each other, that's a good start, but now I think we have to keep playing the game because we need to be it in order to get back I think." Eugene said as he wondered where the heck the group was even supposed to start.

11114.content:
Eugene toggled it to 'immersive' and hit 'start game'. Instantly, the world went dark around them. Eugene immediately sank down, intending to crawl towards the door, and let some light in from the next room, or sneak some daylight in from a window.

But as he reached the floor, he was confused. His hands discovering chill stone, rather than carpet. Running his hand over the flat surface he could feel it wasn't even plain concrete. A frown formed invisibly on his hidden face, as he stood back up.

"Guys..." he called out, suddenly aware how quite they were... How quiet the whole room was. There wasn't any answer, "Not funny..." he said with a faint quiver in his voice.

"I just wish I could see..." The words were barely louder than a whisper, as he spoke to himself. Eugene was startled to see a pale grid fill the air in front of him. He was more surprised to recognise it. It was an inventory list.

Surely an illusion, his hand reached up to swat it away, like a prop his friends had constructed from... luminous painted wood. Or for his hands to pass through it, like the drug fuelled illusion it had to be. Eugene knew he was a geek, even more than his friends, but he never thought they'd doze him with something for their amusement.

As Eugene's hand passed into the grid, he felt something.

An electronic chirp sounded, and he found himself with a torch in his outstretched hand. He almost dropped it in surprise. Only fear of being burned meant he tightened his grip instead.

The room was illuminated in the flickering yellow glow of the torch flames. Holding it high, he could see the vague shape of an ornate ceiling above him. He was able to see around him, a faint glowing sphere of light. The shapes in the darkness were tantalizing. His footsteps echoed as he explored, already enjoying the immersion. Approaching one shape, Eugene discovered it was a statue on a low plinth. A naked woman, dressed only in a diaphanous cloth. Moving around he discovered more statues. Some of the women were blessed with full breasts, others with wide hips. Each had a look of grace, poise and ecstasy on her face. One with a look of beatific satisfaction, a hand cradling a belly swollen with life.

Getting his mental bearings, he realised there were three statues on each side of the room. He thought of them as side, the room felt longer in the other axis. Walking up the centre of the room, he headed for one end of it.

This time, he found a set of ornately carved steps. Walking up them, he could only praise the realism. His feet scuffing over the stone. His hand feeling the warmth of the flame, and his palm the rough bound wood that made his torch.

Holding the torch higher, he lit the base of the largest plinth.

He could make out the shape of a woman's feet and lower legs. She was scaled beyond human dimensions. The statue was twice or three times her real size.

Spotting some writing in the stone platform, Eugene read it. "Aphrodite."

Looking up he had to admire the artist's work, the perfect woman carved exquisitely in the richest marble. Delicate details taken even with her insignificant toes. Even from his low vantage point, he admired the swell of her bust, and the lewd detail given to those stony nipples.
11114.title: They enter the game...

choices: With the dawn Aphrodite's worshippers start to arrive and see the new Eugene.
Eugene fled before any further blessings could be bestowed.
She sighing in relief, and glad he hadn't groped the pregnant woman statue.
Eugene shrieked her horror, surprise and fainted dead away...
111141.content:
Looking up to admire the Goddess' beauty hurt his neck, and Eugene looked around the rest of the temple. As he explored it, Sun started to fill the temple, flooding into the main chamber.

Eugene looked over the other statues, showing the different women. He recognised each of them as typifying some aspect of femininity, virtue, grace, fertility and so forth. As the flame on his torch guttered and went out, the temple was illuminated by the Sun.

Disposing of the extinguished torch, he was able to admire each of the women. He flexed his hand, which was cramping from holding the coarse wood for so long. Curious to see how different sensations could be created by the game, Eugene ran his hands up and down one of the pillars.

Next he found himself drawn to one of the statues. A svelte, athletic woman, he pressed his hands against the chill stone of her body. Running it over the cool stone, from thigh up her flank. He was startled to hear a powerful womans' voice.

"Your compliment was kind, but your transgression needs punishment. I shall combine them to reward your generous words, and remove your masculine offence."

Eugene bucked like a landed fish, as he hunted for the source of the voice. It filled the air without seeming loud, his hunt limited by the ways his hands felt stuck to the stony body of the statue.

Somehow, he knew this was Aphrodite speaking directly to him...

He half wanted to fall to his knees, but his frozen hands made that impossible. Part of him wanted to curtsey too. A fear gripped him, as he pondered the Goddess' threat of reward and punishment combined. Dreading the myths of the time. He continued to thrash as he felt his body start to glow.

Soon his body was too bright to look at, and Eugene felt ill with worry. With a brilliant pulse, the blinding light vanished, as the statue released him. Stumbling back a few steps, Eugene felt different. Blinking his eyes clear of tears, he took in the changes he could already feel.

He was covered in a toga. A firm, full bust making the material cling to his curves. Hips swelled out, far wider than he liked, too.

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/a5/5d/51/...

A laurel crown marked her as one of Aphrodite's chosen. A women to be revered and respected.

1111412.content:
Eugene stared down at his still swelling breasts and did the only sane, logical thing he could think of as a human raised in a rather secular society and being told that magic and gods were just fairy tale fantasies that only existed in books, comics, video games and movies and would never, ever appear in real life.

He screamed like the woman he now was and ran for the nearest darkened doorway he could find. Although running was a bit of a over-statement, as the new proportions of his female body caused him to fall to the hard marble floors more than once with a feminine 'oof' in his new sultry new voice.

"This is NOT happening!" He gasped as he finally seemed to find the movement balance his still swelling features demanding, finally leaving the chamber of Aphrodite and wiggling and jiggling down the stone corridor. Eugene ran (or rather, it was more of a power walk, or power-strut in this case) through the darkness, squeaking in surprise each time a torch roared to life as he approached. There was also a cool breeze that seemed to be grower stiffer the farther he traveled into the dark, as if something was trying to push him back into the chamber of the Greek goddess.

"And what's with that anyway!? I'm pretty sure, no, I KNOW I typed in 'Arabia' into the game! What the HELL am I doing in Greece? Where's all the sand!? The camels!? I should be wearing a turban not..." Eugene paused for a moment to look down at his cleavage, frowning from the unwelcome mounds of flesh before smushed his new toga-puppies against himself with a unflattering grunt to finally reveal his new tiny feet, "NOT SANDALS!"

The currently greek geek felt something ephemeral tug at the hem of his toga and, not daring to look back because he suddenly got the mental picture of the statue FOLLOWING him like a Weeping Angel or something (not that the statue itself wouldn't be terrifying enough), he went back to sprinting down the corridor at the best speed he could manage without flopping onto his new boobs again. But at least he didn't feel as if he was still, uh, 'growing'.

'Maybe it's got something to do with proximity to the statue? Really I just would like some goddamned answers alreaDAAAAAAHH!' Eugene let out a girlish squeal of terror as the hard stone beneath his feet gave way to something soft and slick as he comically slid across the substance and into a rather firm piece of topiary.

"Bleh!" He flailed, distangling himself from the poking branches and spitting a mouthful of leaves out. "AND WHY AM I EVEN HERE!?" He shouted, his new voice echoing into the pin-pricked darkness above him as stars (and other things) began to come into focus around him as his eyes adapted to the dark. Behind him was a massive columned temple, the pillars lit by large braziers. He'd sprinted out of some kind of...side entrance? And around him were the carefully maintained gardens that surrounded the temple; expertly sculpted statues depicting Aphrodite and the other Greek gods...And a bunch of normal looking statue people embracing each other. Here and there were fountains and the entire perimeter, as far as the new blonde could see in the moonless night, was a wall of carefully cut hedges.

"Woah" the chosen of Ares and the blessed of Aphrodite said in unison, but before they could do anything else, the heavy wooden doors of the temple swung open and revealed a lavish and extravagant temple interior that was piled high with gold offerings, silks and incense.At the far end of the chamber was a dais, upon which a beautiful woman (though a pale shadow compared to Eugene) sat, a serene smile on her face.

"Oooh" Eugene cooed, unable to help himself.

"That's the oracle" Judy whispered, "I, uh, wasn't expecting her to actually live up the stories about being so pleasant to look at"

"Uh, excuse me!?" Eugene huffed, suddenly offended.

"Oh I uh, I mean, uh, for a mortal?" Judy stumbled, suddenly panicked.

"Uh huh. I'll remember that, buster" Eugene said with an icy tone, turning her nose up at her flumoxed friend and striding in, putting ALL of her curves to work.

Eugene just mentally kicked himself as he followed after.
1111412242422.title: The girl reaches the harbor...

11114122424221.content:
Judy trudged along behind Eugene, head hung low in shame as his miffed near-lover strutted ahead in indignation. They passed the untidy mounds of offerings that ranged from simple coins to elaborate golden statues to even...wait, was that a SHIP hanging above them!? Judy and Eugene craned their heads as they passed below the enormous hull, from which draped even more coins and various trophies, some of which appeared extremely exotic in nature.

"Woah" He muttered, wishing he could see the rest of the vessel. Ancient Greece was somewhat known for it's elaborate temples but actually seeing one, well, one that hadn't been decked out in weapons and wall sized depictions of gory battles and a very beefy, very angry looking god pointing a spear in his face, back when she was a she, was pretty damn amazing.

"Yeah. This ALMOST makes me want to forgive you for calling me ugly" Eugene said in partial awe, but there was no hiding the venom in her voice. SHE was the blessed of Aphrodite, and SHE was the most beautiful in the room. In ANY room.

"I didn't!" Just began, but he stopped. There was no use arguing with her. 'Ugh, women' He thought as they approached the dais and the silk-clad oracle. There was a moment of silence as the two players were at a lack of what to do, the woman's creepy serene smile and her unblinking stare at both of them beginning to give Eugene the willies. But then the silence was broken as Judy and Eugene found themselves locked in place, unable to move as the oracle came to life.

"Oh chosen of the gods, you have truly saved all of Greece! You journeyed far and against the odds and faced down our foes in the terrible East!" The Oracle rose from her seated position and stepped down the small flight of stairs towards Judy and Eugene, her silk robes flowing in the night breeze.

"For this only the greatest tokens, know this for I have spoken. I bid thee congratulations on your quest, now go to your reward, and take some rest. For soon thou face the the darkened door, the fiery shadow of raging war, and without the secrets you have brought, all of our lives would have been for naught"

The Oracle smiled at the two heroes, and then turned away, walking over to the empty space next to the changed college students, who suddenly found themselves able to move again.

"Uh, what just happened?" Judy said, rubbing his massive arms to get rid of the numbness that had filled them while the computer character spoke.

"I...I think we're in a cutscene? But it's messed up-" Eugene was cut off as the Oracle began speaking once more to no one.

"Exotic creatures from far and away, you bring hope on the darkest day. The viper of the sands, the beauty'd jade, I come before thee, my hands splayed. Deliver to me that which I desire, the secret to save Greece from the fire. Completed be your noble quest, I release thee to a deserve'd rest"

The Oracle stood there for a very long moment, hands outstretched into nothing as her animation cycle began to loop before in the blink of an eye, she reappeared on the dais, the same smile on her face yet she stared straight ahead at the door, as she had when Eugene and Judy had entered the temple.

"Uh..."

"Judy, don't, uh, freak out...But I think our game is bugged. I think we somehow skipped to the last level!" Eugene's big, brown eyes were open wide as she looked around in fear. If this was the penultimate level...They didn't have the key item they needed to move forward! They really had skipped directly to the end but they were stuck!

"Wait. So you're telling me this is the end of the game? Dude, we can totally just end the game and get back to normal! BOOBS I'M COMING HOME!" Judy bellowed in excitement. Not that it hadn't been fun seeing what it was like as a really strong guy, but he was definitely ready to be a she again.

"No! We...Judy, we need to give the Oracle whatever it is she's looking for! Without it, we're...we're stuck like this!" Eugene's eyes were welling up with tears as she looked down at her incredible body. The whole 'sex god influence' moment aside, being a woman had been fun...But she definitely wanted to go back to normal! She wanted to go home!

"Oh." Was all Judy could say when the realization hit him. The juggernaut of muscled manliness staggered as his knees grw weak, and he collapsed against the dais. "Peter!" He wailed, tears finally filling his own eyes. He...SHE didn't want to be stuck like this! She had such a future ahead of her! Getting on at a museum! Maybe writing a novel! Having kids and being a better mom than hers ever was! It...it couldn't be gone! Not like this! All because she wanted to help some poor nerd ask his crush out!

Eugene was in similar straits, though vicious sniffling and sheer man (or woman) power keeping them at bay as she went through her own mental anguish. So much for hooking up with Lindsey, or getting on at a game company. Or seeing mom again...

Wait.

"Judy...Peter and Lindsey! THEY must be the 'viper' and the 'jade' things the Oracle was supposed to be talking to! If...If things are messed up, then maybe we just need to go find them? Maybe we just have to load into, uh, different levels! If we're near the end, then maybe they're back at the beginning! We just have to find them!" Hope sprang into Eugene's bountiful chest as HE threw together the barest bones of a plan. "This world is immersive, right? And we were supposed to be in Arabia, right? Then we just GO there and start looking!"

Judy wiped her nose on a bronze bracer, leaving a streak of snotty slime, "O-oh y-yeah? How are w-we supposed to d-do that!? We don't e-even know what they lo-look like!!"

"Yes we do!" Eugene's voice was full of determination as he strutted over to Judy and lifted his slender arm, "We just look for people that have THESE on their arms!"

There, tattooed against the flawless flesh of the geek's wrist, were five black bars.
_

The girl gave one last look into the darkness of the slave ship, giving the terrified looking slave girl a grin that she hoped looked more confident than she felt. And then she was up the ladder, moving slowly and steadily and praying that the wood or the hatch didn't creak as she raised it up just enough to peek out onto the deck. Four shirtless men moved about the deck, one with a rag, the other carrying a crate, a third one messing with some rope and another one that the girl couldn't see, but could hear. The one that she assumed was the captain sat at the far end of the ship on a chair, grunting orders at the others in between drinking and fondling another girl in chains. She'd have to move fast and somehow take them all out, she'd only have one shot at this and if she failed, well...She had to suppose it said something about her state of mind that she ended up dead rather than chained below, waiting to be sold to the highest bidder.

And she was certain that, in this particular city, that was the Old Man on the Horse. And she was particularly certain that she had to stay away from him at all costs. Luckily though, there had been a large drum near the ladder, and by a even greater stroke of luck, one of the heavy mallets used for striking out a beat to the slave rowers had been left unattended. It hung heavy in her arms but it was the only thing that she had, and she'd have to make it work.

After a minute or two of peeking and memorizing the crew as they moved back and forth in almost predictable patterns, the girl summoned up her courage and lifted the hatch all the way up, barreling out of the hold as fast as she could manage.

"Huh?" The crew member with the rag said dumbly as he spotted the blur of brown motion charging at him in the torch light. He had just enough time to scream before something fast and hard caved in his face. He gurgled once and slumped to the deck.

"One" The girl grunted as she pivoted towards the crewman with the rope, who was now shouting at her. The man thrw the rope and the girl felt it slide around her, and she let out a raspy 'oof!' as the man tugged, the rope tightening around her throat and cutting off her oxygen. She resisted the urge to fall to her knees and her rapidly graying vision as she swung blindly ahead...And gasped sharply as the crewman flew over the side of the ship with a canned scream that sounded VERY familiar, as if it had been used in hundreds of movies and TV shows before.

The girl rounded on the man with the box, who simply threw it at her before charging. She easily ducked beneath the box and thrust the drumstick forward, catching the man in his crotch. He squealed and fell to the deck, where she finished him off with a couple of rapid kicks to the head. The girl spun around, looking for the fourth crewman, only to hear a heavy tump behind her, and massive arms wrap around her tiny body, locking her in place as she struggled.

"Heh. Bring her to me" The captain slurred, and the girl felt herself lifted up like she was nothing. A giant must have been holding her as she was carried across the deck before being deposited on her knees at the foot of the captain's chair. She looked up, hared in her eyes for the leering man, glancing for just a moment at the slave girl next to him, who looked at her with sympathy but didn't dare move.

"Thought you could escape? I don't know how you got out...but you'll wish you'd stayed in those chains, girl..." The captain said as he held the girl's face in his leathery hand. Another hand brushed away her stray hair before slipping down to her breasts.

"See Fazad! Women are such mewling creatures, they desire to be shown proper dominance and...discipline." The captain licked his lips, "I believe I need to sample my property before I sell it. You're very lucky, slave, only the luckiest get to know this pleasure"

The captain leaned in for a sloppy kiss, and the girl spat in his face, mucus dripping off his nose.

"INSOLENT BITCH!" He roared, raising his hand to strike her...
11114122424221.title: Eugene and Judy get their fortune...And a mission.

111141224242211.content:
"So wait, you want us to go half-way across Greece, and believe me, it is literally half-way, and then jump on a boat and sail to the Middle East? And then what, we stick out like a couple of olives in a date market while we poke around looking for Peter and Lindsey?" Judy flicked away the tears in her smoldering eyes with a harsh laugh, "You'd have better luck trying to sell a wooden horse to a bunch of second generation Trojans"

"It's all we've got, Judy! Unless you wanna stay here with Ms. Smiles over there or move into that house you almost broke and end up drunk cause we look like some god's mom and dad? I'm really not interested in being the starring role in some Greek comedy" Eugene said, cocking a hand on one of his wide hips.

"You weren't complaining before..."

"Yeah, because we were being stupid and not paying attention to GAME. MECHANICS. But now we know that we're in a bugged game, right? I'm Good. At. Video. Games. and I think that if we just pay attention we might just be able to fix things before we really do end up stuck here and I'm popping out demigod babies every nine months until we both die five times from something you can take a goddamn Tylenol for back home!" Eugene stamped his foot and ignored the jiggling of his breasts.

"But that's still a literal world away! Do you even know how big the world is perceived to be now? Let's say that we do this, and we use your game mechanics, right? But if this...world is so detailed and life-like, it will take us weeks, if we're lucky, to get to Athens. I could probably make it, but YOU'RE not built for cross-country. And even if we made it without getting eaten by some mythological beasts, since if the gods are acting through us right now, you can bet there's a goddamn hydra out there, or a cyclops, just waiting to eat us. And then, and THEN, we somehow get a boat that is willing to sail into the HEART of Greece's most hated enemy?" Judy got up, dusted her bulky body off and leaned against the Oracle's dais with a derisive snort,

"That's weeks at sea, dealing a crew, probably a sea monster, pirates, and then it's just, you know, the tiny detail of trying to navigate what was then the LARGEST NATION ON EARTH and some how not die in our sleep five times simply because we're Greeks in Persia. Assuming, of course, we can even 'load' earlier 'levels'. Forget it, I may look like Hercules but I am NOT a fighter!" Judy flexed a bicep for show, but it was true. She had NO idea of what to do if they actually got into a fight. Would the game take over? Or was it up to her just to swing a sword around and get lucky? And then what use was Eugene? He just looked gorgeous and hadn't demonstrated any kind of 'gameplay power'.

"So you just want to wait here, like a coward? I don't know why it's not affecting us here, but Judy, if we DON'T take an active role in events, we're GOING to become part of the game, lives or not! What would have happened if we just went into that building and fucked? Do you really think it's just some coincidence that every time we were about to bang the game interrupted us? It WANTS us to play! If we just sit here we could end up as a couple of NPCs and NEVER get out!" That was something Eugene was pretty concerned about. Down in the city everything had gotten...swampy, there were so many torches, and according to Judy's earlier history lesson when walking up to the Oracle's temple, she'd mentioned something about torches being a symbol of Eros. And there were a LOT of torches down there.

"YES! Like I told you on the stairs, Oracles were Apollo's domain! No other god can interfere in an Oracle's temple! Look, we're clearly supposed to 'rest' after turning in the quest, right? So to me, that means free room and board for the night. Given we can't advance anything, we can just live here until Peter and Lindsey catch up with us! And then we turn in the quest, fight the boss and go home!" The towering goth stomped around the temple, kicking scattered tribute lightly as to not accidentally damage their potential future home.

"Judy, what if THEY get stuck? We were given these bodies for a reason, there's clearly specific roles that WE have to play in order to beat the game! You're the warrior, the tank, you take the hits and give them. I'm clearly the money man...Well, woman, but I'm the one with all the gold right now. Maybe I have another power, who knows, but you don't have any cash, I do, so clearly what we are serves a purpose. What if Lindsey is a healer? Healers ALWAYS die first in video games, and what if Peter is some kind of a spell caster, or a stealth melee class? Or an archer that can't win a fistfight? Neither of those survive long without the support of the party" Eugene was stretching the truth a little bit, he'd played World of Warcraft long enough to know that really, really good players in those classes could solo group content or take on enemy players teams on their own, but he had to convince Judy to get out of the temple.

"I refuse to believe that this game, as powerful and detailed and CLEARLY magical, would be that short-sighted and not let 'Immersive Mode' be free to do however you wanted. I'd honestly rather take my chances with trying to walk through the mythological nightmare. I'm not fucking leaving Eugene, so...Get used to those boobs. Maybe you can invent the bra why we wait" Judy stepped up on the dais and shoved the static Oracle out of her way, taking a rather violent seat on the lavish pile of pillows and furs that were stacked behind the frozen soothsayer.

Eugene fumed at the goth's stubborness. But then he got an idea. If reaching out to her and trying to make her see video game logic wasn't working...The blonde beauty that was actually a fat little nerd looked around the temple room for a few minutes, casting glances at Judy, who was busy rubbing her temples and muttering to herself. There was so much treasure here, there had to be a...

"AHA!" Eugene cried out, his voice echoing off the high ceiling of the temple interior as he pulled a jewel encrusted sword out of a pile of gold coins, disrupting the balance of the pile and sending the currency spilling out across the stone floor noisily, causing Judy to look up.

"Uh Gene, what are you doing?" Judy tried not to chuckle as the geeky blonde struggled to hold the sword over his head, his arms wavering and impossibly pretty face scrunched in exertion, a shiny sheen of sweat already forming on his otherwise immaculate brow.

"I...I'm gonna...oof!" Eugene stopped trying to hold the sword which shouldn't have been that heavy, fall to the floor with a CLANG. He let out a long and heavy exhale from the strain and tried to lift it again, only managing to lift the blade about an inch from the floor this time. 'Well, this is awkward...' He thought, his plan already falling apart. But he wasn't going to give up, and began crab-walking as best he could towards the temple doors.

"Hey, where are you going?" Judy said as she stood up from the bed of cushions behind the unmoving Oracle, amused and confused as her friend slowly made his way out of the temple.

Eugene groaned as he dropped the sword once more, "Ugh, why didn't I wake up in the temple of Athena? At least if I had to be a chick, I'd have some muscles!"

Judy sighed and stepped down from the dais, taking three long strides with her powerful legs until she was next to Eugene. "Athena is a bitch anyway. Did I ever tell you what she did to Medusa?" She hefted the sword onto her shoulder with minimal effort, earning a tired grin from the weak beauty.

"So, what's your plan?"

"You wanna sacrifice a goat?" Eugene made a slicing motion with his tiny hands.

"...What?"
__

The girl could do nothing against the muscles that restrained her, pinning her face down against the deck as her curvy rear was thrust up into the air. She could feel the captain's leathery hands as they caressed her buttocks, and she gave a pleading stare up at the motion-less slave girl next to the captain's chair, who simply looked away.

"Yes, I believe this piece of meat will fetch quite a sum tomorrow at the auction...Though I could just keep it all for myself. What do you think, Fazad?" The girl heard the ripping of fabric as what was left of her dress was torn apart, her bare skin shivering in the cool sea air.

There was a wordless grunt in reply. There was the sound of metal jingling and the girl felt a large amount of clothing suddenly collapse over her feet. There was a sharp slap of her rear and she couldn't help but let out a whimper, fearing what was to come. Why did she have to play the hero? She scrunched her eyes tight, mentally preparing herself for what was to come...

"Quite, I am getting a bit bored with the other one...Wait, what is that?"

The girl cracked open a dark brown eye, and through the veil of her dark hair could see something misty and...green? creeping over the deck railing in thick tendrils. The broken slave girl let out a scream as it curled around her and the girl swore that it looked like some kind of...dragon? The slave seemed to fade away into the green mist, her voice growing fainter and fainter as she disappeared from view...And the pair of iron shackles that had been around her wrist fell to the floor with a loud clang.

"What is this!? What are you doing, witch!" The captain roared behind her, and the girl was suddenly freed from the crushing grip. She spun around to see both men suffer a similar fate as the green mist curled around them. The two seemed to evaporate as they swung wildly at the mists, screaming as the strange mist dragons consumed them.

And then they were gone, their clothes fluttering to the floor in silence as the mist quickly retreated.

Not wanting to question providence, the girl quickly pawed through the captain's abandoned clothes and pulled out a large iron ring of keys and scurried back into the ship's hold, and the other tattooed girl.
111141224242211.title: Eugene & Judy discuss their options.

1112.content:
"I like Greece" Peter piped up, "Something like Hercules or Xena or 300!" He said, standing up to flex his muscles for the group, "I'm pretty much a Spartan anyway, I wanna kick a guy into a pit!"

Eugene frowned at the display of macho manliness, and suddenly felt self-conscious about his flabby arms as he looked down at his feet.

"Uh sure you are" Judy said, catching Eugene looking away. She reached up and gently pulled Peter back to the couch, who gave her a quizzical look, "But yes. Greece sounds FINE. And before everything went crazy I was writing a paper on Greek myths anyway, so maybe I'll get to put all that to good use!"

"Okay, that's two for Greece...Guess it's down to you and me Lindsey, what do you want to do?" Eugene said looking up again as Peter was pulled down. The rainbow haired girl put a sparkly finger to her pink lips for a moment and made an audible 'HMMMMMM' for dramatic effect as she thought about her choice.

After a moment Eugene swore he could hear the Jeopardy! theme playing from somewhere else in the dorm building.

"Greece is fine, I guess! I mean if this is fun and stuff, we can just, like, play another game after!" The displaced sorority girl said with a cheery smile. It honestly didn't bother her one bit, she really just wanted to see the cool and totally retro looking machine in action and if it really did all the things Eugene said it would.

"Majority rules, I guess" Eugene said with a (mostly) mock sigh of disappointment. He settled his fingers over the keyboard and carefully typed in "GREECE" and hit enter. The machine made a buzzing sound before it began a series of mechanical clicks and something that Lindsey pointed out sound like an old dial-up modem, which only she had really any true knowledge of because of her computer classes and they were all young enough that they never knew of a time where one could not be on the Internet and use the phone at the same time.

After about a minute of internal noises from the machine, silence returned to the room with a loud POP as two large black buttons snapped out from the top of the game, with the words 'TRADITIONAL' and 'IMMERSIVE' stenciled on them in chipped white lettering. A flap on the side flipped open and a tray holding four small figurines, each lacking much detail and each a bright primary color, slid out. There was what looked to be a blue large, muscled man holding a sword over his head, a yellow shorter human figure in what looked to be a toga carry what appeared to be a rock and chain in it's hands, a red half-horse, half-man creature with a bow and arrow...And what was very clearly Medusa, a green molded plastic tail extending from a human torso that was topped by a fanged head that was ringed with delicate looking plastic snakes.

"PLEASE CHOOSE A GAME MODE"

"Are you kidding me? MORE choices?" Peter complained as he rubbed his forehead. This was too much thinking for something that didn't involve a football.

"Oh hush" Judy said, softly bapping his left knee with a slap, "It's just one more, right Eugene?"

"Uh, yeah. We just..." Eugene paused and pulled up the game's box again to read more of the instructions, "After we choose a game type, it'll let us choose our avatars. Then we just type in 'Player' and the number on the back of the miniatures, then just type in 'start' and it'll begin"

"Then let's pick something already!" Peter said impatiently from his spot on the couch.

"Wait..." Eugene mumbled as he squinted at the instructions.

"Oh great" The jock groaned.

"If we choose Traditional mode, we have to input the number of spaces and then wait for it to print out the game map. Then it'll our dice and THEN we type in start" Eugene said as he scratched his head. 'That was weird, was all that text really there just a minute ago?' The geek thought as he stared at what he had just assumed was an empty section of the box. He pushed up his glasses and rubbed his eyes; he just must have been seeing things.

Eugene looked back to his friends, Judy who was frowning slightly, Lindsey who had pulled out her phone and Peter who was staring up at the ceiling. They were getting bored.

"Anyway, what does everyone want to do? Majority rules votes?"

"That sounds fine, Eugene" Judy said, slapping Peter's chest with a long nailed hand, "Doesn't it Pete?"

"Yeah, sure, whatever"

"Well, show of hands, who wants..." Eugene began.
1112.title: Going Greek: Game Mode Selection

choices: The group recovers a few minutes later.
11121.content:
"Show of hands, who wants Traditional Mode?" Eugene said, and watched a muscled arm, a pale, tattooed arm, and one that was covered in bracelets, bangles and two different colored glowstick bands shoot up into the air of the common room. He felt himself deflate a little; the geek had been hoping for Immersive mode to see just what exactly the game would do. Would it have played the role of dungeon master, or something like one of those old fashioned MUD games?

"Okay okay, democracy works!" Eugene chuckled and with a tiny bit of dramatic flourish, stuck out his right index finger and pushed the big black button that read 'TRADITIONAL'. There was an audible click, and a whirring noise emanated from within the machine as a soft breeze of warm hot began to blow out from a tiny vent on it's side.

"PLEASE INPUT GAME LENGTH" The game spoke again.

"Okay, last big choice, how many spaces do we want to have?" Eugene said as he glanced at the box and the column of rules that were under the word 'TRADITIONAL', "We each get one normal dice to roll, singles and double rolls get two turns...If anyone rolls a six they have to pull a 'Challenge Card'."

"Um, what are those?" Lindsey said, scooting her beanbag closer to the table. Eugene forced himself not to look at the blonde's breasts as they bounced up and down with each consecutive scoot and instead buried his head in the box.

"Traditional mode has 'Action Squares' and 'Challenge Cards'. If we land on a square, the game will announce an action for us to perform...And the cards are sort of the same thing but they're just much more specific. They're kind of like Monopoly cards, they make the game more exciting"

"What game? All we've done is talk" Peter muttered, getting a soft elbow to the ribs from Judy.

"Please continue, Eugene" Judy said sweetly as she glared at her boyfriend.

"Uh, right. Uh...Players can't roll again until they've done the Action Square or a Challenge Card, and we ALL have to reach the end of the game before the game ends. Whoever gets there first has to wait on the others, and then we all have to say 'Morphmanji!' for the game to end...And whoever got to the end first gets a wish?"

"What?" Three heads said in unison.

"I don't know. That's all it says. 'The Player that reached the end first gets to make a wish'. I guess maybe one of us will have to type in something and we'll get a special ending?

"That sounds dumb"

"Peter!"

"What? It does! It's just a game, not like it can actually make wishes come true or anything!"

Eugene shrugged, "It's old. You know how old games can be. Anyway, since at max we can only move six spaces at a time, how many squares do we want? it will generate the Action Squares and Challenge Card spaces at random so we don't have to put those in"

"Is there, like, a default number of spaces?" Lindsey said, giving the machine a curious poke.

"Yeah, the default is 36 spaces, but we could make it longer or shorter if we wanted"

"I like 36. It totally sounds like a good number to play with the first time through" Lindsey continued to poke the machine, her desire to crack it open and see how it worked growing stronger by the minute. It was just so cool!

"36 fine with you and Judy, Peter?" Eugene asked, and his friends on the couch nodded. Satisfied, he looked down at the keyboard and typed in 'DEFAULT' on the small keys and watched as the word lit up on the one screen the game machine had, the red lights glowing brightly as they spelled out his choice. The geek pressed 'enter' with a chunky finger and sat back.

"PLEASE WAIT. PRODUCING GAME MAP." The machine called out, and yet another unseen flap opened on the domed electronic device as paper, somehow already loaded, began slowly inching out of the set of rollers as the sounds of a printer buzzed from inside the faded plastic shell. The group took this time to use the bathroom or get some refreshments, and five minutes later they returned to the common room.

On the table, draped off the side due to the game machine taking up most of it, was a black and white paper game board that had a set of four elaborate tiled paths that curled and twisted around and across each other, each path broken only by the words 'Action Square' and 'Draw Card' interjected at random points across the map. The only place that seemed to have a uniform symmetrical dispersion of 'Action Squares' were the points were each path intersected with each other, and at the very center was a small circle that had 'Morphmanji' printed across the center.

"PLEASE SELECT AVATAR AND INPUT PLAYER ROLL ORDER. TYPE START AND ENTER TO BEGIN" The game buzzed, almost as if it was slightly annoyed that it had to wait on the young adults to return to it.

"Well, you heard it. Let's pick who we're going to be." Eugene said, reaching out a hand as the lid of the miniature case flipped open and tiny servos raised the plastic figurines out to be selected. The nerd had thought about it, and how Peter's show of muscles had made his insecurity about his weight flare up...Even if it was just pretend, maybe it'd be nice to be the...

"DIBS ON HERCULES" Peter shouted, a freight train sized fist shooting forward and gabbing the muscled, sword swing warrior, knocking Eugene's hand out of the way.

"PETER TZIMEROS, STOP!" Judy shouted right as the jock's cable-like fingers wrapped around the blue swordsman.

"What!?" Peter whined back, but then stopped as he saw that look in her eyes. He knew that look, and it always meant trouble. He let loose a mental sigh as he sat back on the couch.

"This is Eugene's game. It's only fair that he choose first" Judy said, matter of factly.

"But-" Peter began, but fell silent as Judy's glare intensified, "Ugh okay. Geno you get first pick bro"

"T-thanks, Pete" Eugene stammered, and with a shaking hand, pulled the blue muscle man out of his cradle, Peter letting loose a sigh of disappointment.

"DIBS ON THE CENTAUR DUDE!" Lindsey shouted, darting out to pluck the equinoid. Peter stared wide eyed at the development. BOTH of the muscled guys were gone!

"Well fine" He pouted, and reached out towards the machine, "Guess I'll just play as Medusa then" Peter's hands clasped the tiny gorgon and brought it up to his face, examining the yellow monster. "Man, I can believe that someone this ugly WOULD be a monster! She must have been a horrible bitch" He chuckled, and was promptly swatted on the back of the head by his girlfriend.

"You did NOT just say that! I'll have you know that Medusa is a VICTIM, not a MONSTER!" Judy reached out and plucked the tiny yellow snake-woman from her boyfriend's palm, "She was RAPED by Poseidon, and then tries to defend herself to Athena, supposedly a 'good' goddess, SHE just turned Medusa into a monster for daring to speak out against the gods! And then she got stuck in a cave and had to fight for her LIFE every DAY because of all the assholes that tried to KILL her just for their own personal glory!"

Peter, Eugene and Lindsey simply stared wide eyed at the now red-face goth.

"So yeah, Medusa was a victim against impossibly hopeless circumstances, and since I'm the only one who wrote a paper about her, I'M going to play her!" Judy's nostrils flared with indignation as she stomped over and grabbed another lounge chair, abandoning Peter on the couch.

"Judy, babe, I didn't-" Peter stammered as he tried to wade out of the emotional hot water he found himself in.

""Just pick the Or-The mace-guy and let's get started, okay?" Judy said, plopping HER Medusa down on the game board.

"Mace-guy? For someone majoring in mythology that sure doesn't sound like a technical term" Peter said, and instantly regretted the petty comment. Not willing to risk getting sucked out deeper into the boiling hot water sea, he shut his mouth and grabbed the tiny red figure that was holding the rock and chain.

"Uh...We don't have to play if-" Eugene suggested, but only received an angry sigh from Judy in return.

"No, we've come this far, we're going to ALL play this game, Gene" She said slowly and carefully, while staring daggers at her boyfriend who simply withered under her triggered gaze.

"Uh...'kay" Eugene mumbled. "I guess give me your numbers and I'll type them in then?"

"I'm player 4" Judy snapped.

"Um, like, 3?" Lindsey squeaked timidly as she put her green centaur on the board.

"Two" Peter mumbled, doing the same.

"Okay uh just, uh, just a second!" Eugene sputtered and he quickly typed the information into the game's keyboard. With Judy's Medusa entered, Eugene typed in START and then pressed ENTER.

"BEGINNING QUEST OF THE TITANS. ALL PLAYERS ASSUME STARTING POSITIONS. DISPENSING DICE" The game intoned.

"OMG, my stomach hurts!" Lindsey cried out suddenly, rolling off her beanbag, hands clutching her abdomen. Her numerous bands of jewelry creaking as her arms began to swell and change color, as if she was having an allergic reaction.

"Lindsey!" Eugene shouted, but suddenly he felt hot. Really hot. he was instantly soaked in sweat as his breaths turned heavy and fast as the world suddenly became hyper-defined and over saturated with color. The geek collapsed backwards into his chair and felt impossibly heavy.

"Guys, I, Did-did someone spike my...drink?" Peter said woozily as the world began swimming. He...he didn't do drugs they...drug tested players and...Peter's mind failed to finish it's train of thought as he toppled sideways on the couch and passed out, long strands of black hair falling across his face.

And Judy, a splitting migraine suddenly filled her skull, as did the intense urge to vomit. She stood and lurched towards the bathroom...Only to find her legs tripping over each other as she fell to the floor with a heavy, hissing thud.

111211.content:
Eugene was, literally, paralyzed. His body throbbed with what felt like electricity as he lay frozen and sprawled across the suddenly tiny feeling lounge chair. He could what felt like boulder sized droplets of sweat boiling up out of his skin and soaking every single article of clothing he wore as they hung heavily of of him, but there was nothing he could do. All he could do was stare up at the flourescent bulbs on the ceiling of the common room as their buzzing and off-white colors continued to intensify.

Was he having a stroke? Did the machine explode and electrocute him? What was happening?

And then the ringing, the buzzing stopped and the colors of the room returned to normal. And then a loud creaking noise filled his ears as the lounge chair burst apart and dropping him suddenly, and painfully, to the floor.

"Holy shit!" Eugene cried out, and was immensely relieved at the face he could talk and move again, pulling himself upright. He wiped his face and then froze as a giant, gloriously golden-browned tanned wall of flesh with fingers attached flew at his face. But when he froze, so did the giant hand. "Wait, what?" And that was when he noticed the deepness of his voice now, the thunderous rumble a far cry from his normally reedy, nasally tones. Strands of brown hair slid into his vision, and he cautiously raised what was obviously his had up to feel a mane of hair that was clearly NOT the short ear-length hairdo he preferred. He stared at the hair for a moment and then followed the alien hand down an arm that looked as if he'd spent a lifetime lifting impossibly huge weights. And he had TWO of them!

That was when he looked down, and was greeted by a body that looked as if it had been expertly chiseled out of stone and laid bare to the world. Gone was his t-shirt, he was naked from the top down to his barely covered groin, with swollen, muscled pecks that topped what felt like an endless column of rippling abs that ran all the way down to twin trunks of legs that were swollen with powerful, tightly bound muscles. A loincloth covered his groin, made out of some kind of scaled and tanned leather...And he was absolutely sure about what was between his legs didn't belong to him. It was definitely NOT as huge as it currently felt, cradled in what felt like animal fur? Eugene was afraid to look and instead examined the elaborate laced sandals that wrapped his slab-like feet and ran up most of his shins.

He'd been transformed! But..How? And why? Did the game do this?

"Guys, look at me!" Eugene rumbled, but his eyes went wide and his jaw went slack as he saw.

On the couch across from him lay a stunning brunette woman, easily the prettiest he'd ever seen. Her angular features were still, her long-lidded eyes closed and her puffy red lips parted as she breathed slowly in and out, he large breasts rising as falling beneath the white toga that draped her frame. Long slender legs spilled from the bottom of the toga and ended in tiny feet that were wrapped in similar, if smaller sandals to Eugene's own, and two womanly arms hung limp and were decked in large bronze bracelets, one of which was attached to a heavy chain that spooled off the couch.

"Peter?" Eugene gasped.

"Oh, my stomach!" A voice almost deeper than his own complained next to him, and Eugene's he snapped towards the source, his eyes practically exploding as he saw a MASSIVE creature, half-horse, half body-builder human struggle to sit up. Four powerful legs kicked slowly and a hairy tail thumped against the floor while the bearded, wild haired man-half groaned...And then froze in shock as red eyes snapped open.

"OH. MY. GAWD!" The man roared in terror, "I'M A DUDE HORSE!"

"Lindsey!?" Eugene gasped.

"WHO ARE YOU!? WHAT DID YOU DO TO ME!?" The centaur that was obviously his friend and current crush screamed, her legs kicking wildly and knocking the table across the room, the game machine clattering noisily as it threatened to tumble over the approaching table edge. Strangely enough though, the four tiny figurines and the similarly colored dice did not move at all.

"Woah! It's me Linds! It's...It's Eugene!" The geek scrambled to his feet and suddenly realized he TOWERED over everything. Before he'd been a fairly normal 5 foot 6 inches but now...He was WELL over 6 feet tall. "Woah..." He whispered.

"EUGENE!? LIKE, WHAT HAPPENED!?" The half-equine former female whined as Eugene held out a hand, and was surprised at the powerful grip of the rough, leather hand that grabbed at it. "Like, help me up!"

Eugene tensed his muscles and pulled against Lindsey's manly hand, silently lamenting the fact that this was the first time he'd held her hand and it had to be with her as a horse-monster. A MALE horse-monster. But he had no time to contemplate or complain, Lindsey's massive body came flying up at him as he clearly over-compensated his new strength.

"EEK!" Lindsey bellowed as she FLEW across the common room, Eugene letting go of her hand in shock as she sailed into the kitchen area and crashed to a halt against the refridgerator, practically crumpling it in half. There was a moment of shocked silence before she stumbled to all fours and grabbed her head.

"Oooww!" She moaned.

"Oh jesus, I'm sorry!" Eugene cried, but as he attempted to go help, a feminine grunt came from the couch.

"Ugh, who...who spiked my drink? Ugh did I get sick or something, why does my...voice" The woman on the couch said, her accented voice groggy as she pushed herself upright before freezing in place, staring down at her chest as her eyes widened in horror. "HOLY SHIT!"

"Peter?" Eugene said, caught between helping Lindsey and a sudden urge to help the former beefcake jock.

"WHO THE FUCK ARE YOU!?" The woman screamed as she scrambled across the couch, tripping over herself and as the chain drew taut, was pulled backwards with a screech. Eugene looked at the object that had weighed her down and blinked. It was...a rock? Or maybe a large pot? It was roughly cone shaped and was decorated head to toe in elaborate carvings. He couldn't read the words but the images certainly looked like greek things he'd seen on Wikipedia and in video games.

"I'm Eugene!" The newly giant teen explained to the shocked woman.

"And I'm Lindsey!" The centaur wailed as she trotted back to the common room before stopping her tracks. "OHMYGAWD THERE'S SOMETHING HANGING OFF ME!"

Lindsey flailed and twisted, trying her best to look under her hairy new body, but Peter and Eugene's eyes zeroed in on what it was: There, like a tank rifle and a pair of oil drums, was a large penis and balls dangling for the world to see.

"Uh, Linds?" Eugene said, wondering if his new body had a package that large, "You, uh, you're a guy now so, uh..."

"OMG OMG OMG OHMUHGAWD!" She roared and began prancing around bucking, which did NOT h elp matters. 'GET IT OFF! I WANNA TURN BACK!"

"We...we can't!" Came a oddly distorted voice from behind the couch. Lindsey stopped her wild bucking and clopped to a stop, her new manhood swinging wildly as she, Eugene and, after a moment, Peter looked around for it's owner.

"You guysss heard Eugene, we have to finisssh the game before we can change back!" The voice said with a soft hiss.

"Who...Wait, Judy!" Peter gasped and looked over the back of the couch, "OH FUCK!" He screamed again and tumbled backwards, landing on the floor of the common room.

"Don-don't look at me! I'm a...I'm a gorgon!" Judy wailed from behind the upholstery, "If I look at you I'll turn you to ssstone!"

There was a rustle and multitude of smaller, quieter hisses as scaly green shoulders rose above the couch.

"Oh fuck!" Eugene mumbled in shock as the head that followed was a twisting next of angry looking vipers who coiled and twisted and slithered back and forth. Long, similarly scaled arms were raised, elongated talon topped hands covering the entirety of Judy's new face as she slowly turned, revealing her reptillian new form. Her torso was a soft tan, the scales longer and more sequential and they flowed over a pair of modest breasts that were cupped in a silver and leather breastplate...And that was all she wore. A huge tail coiled and rose above the top of the couch as Judy rose high and higher, rising to ye level with Eugene.

"We're all...mythological beingsss. The game changed usss. I'm a gorgon, Lindsssey isss a centaur, Eugene you're sssome kind of demigod, obviousssly and Peter...Oh Peter, I'm sssorry!" Judy said as she bobbed and curled around herself.

"What!? Did YOU dod this Judy?" Peter said, rising unsteadily to his new feet and wobbling as his new curves jiggled, "I...YOU SAID I WAS GONNA BE A MACE GUY! I'M A CHICK! AND WHAT THE HELL IS THIS ROCK!?"

"I'm sssorry! I wasss upssset! You're an oracle! The Pythia! You can sssee the future! The rock isss the Omphalosss Ssstone! It givesss you the visssionsss!"

"Judy, how can you, like, see us if you're covering your face?" Lindsey asked with a involuntary clop of a hoof on the kitchen tile.

"It'sss the sssnakes! I can sssee out of them! It'sss asss weird for me asss it isss for you!"

"TURN ONE START. ALL PLAYERS MAY ROLL." The game announced from it's new spot in the corner. All four pairs of eyes (or at least three pairs and a multitude of small heads).

"I...Guess We better start playing" Eugene said, walking over and grabbing the small blue cube that rested next to the figurine he now macro-embodied.
