111211111112111111.content:
“HERO! HERO COME QUICK! THE PYTHIA NEEDS YOU!” Peri’s voice echoed through the darkness, and Eugene turned away from Judy, whose threatening hisses ended with a questioning grunt as she looked up towards the mouth of the cavern, a claw pulling away from the weak binding that kept her deadly power sealed.

Demigod looked at monster, all of the previous animosity between the two vanishing as they simultaneously said “Peter!”, and began rushing upwards out of the dank underground abyss, the light of Eugene’s sword guiding his mighty strides while Judy rippled effortlessly over the maze of debris that filled the throat of the cave. And then they were out, the flickering light of the bonfire casting long shadows as they gazed upon the scene in front of them. Peter was floating slightly off the ground, arms out-stretched and his torn robe red and dripping from being doused in wine, his gods-given breasts revealed for the world (or at least the gathered players plus…’guests’). A rather sizable portion of the formerly white robe was hanging from one of Lindsey’s outstretched and gnarled hands, and the centaur herself was openly ogling Peter’s body, her massive horse-cock straight as a rod and throbbing.

But then Peter spoke, his voice once more heavily accented, but not soft and silky like it had been before. This time his voice was loud, powerful, and had a rather masculine reverb echoing off of it. His brown eyes were open wide and glowing with angry looking light, tendrils of magical, clearly divine, energy flickering out of Peter’s eyes as she glared down at Lindsey, who was clearly too drunk to be anything more than amused.

“If thou act a beast, my anger you should fear the least. So given to your craven desires you have provoked the gods’ ire. Blessed you were, and so shall stay but now no woman shall look your way. A more fitting form you’ll find for thee, perhaps a horn or two or three. Cursed you are, from friends be riven and banished, no longer will you have centaur magic. Take delight in your feotid breath, be thankful that you face not DEATH. Apollo strikes thee with his light, now cry foul heathen for his delight!”

As Peter spoke a dark cloud gathered along the common room’s ceiling, rippling with flashes of lightning and thunder. Something seemed to pass over Lindsey’s face and the drunken, leering grin faded away to uncertainty, and then out right terror as the impossible storm whipped itself into a maelstrom of thunder and lightning, a pinprick of light appearing at it’s core.

Eugene felt the urge to race across from the cavern’s opening, to tackle the possessed Peter to the ground and roll him out of danger, but a thick tail wrapped around his legs and he turned with a growl towards the Gorgon looming out of the shadows behind him.

“Let me go, Judy!” Eugene rumbled, grabbing at his friend’s coils, but then the sound and noise stopped, and Peter let loose a shriek as he dropped to the ground, the gaggle of handmaidens rushing forward and dragging their beloved mistress over to the small fort made up of hastily overturned benches and chairs and more than a few pots. Meanwhile the light continued to grow in intensity in the center of the storm before a thematic WOOSH shook the entire dorm building as an arrow of what looked to be pure light shot down from the glowing portal above the stricken sorority girl.

“AaaaAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!!!!” Lindsey roared as her drunken form was struck squarely in the chest, and suddenly a vast pillar of fiery golden light erupted from her broad, hairy chest, growing quickly to consume her entire form as she roared and screamed in terror and pain. Eugene was suddenly VERY afraid that if the gods really did exist (because of course they did, who else would have given him all of this?) then they were smiting his former crush from existence. And without her…They couldn’t finish the game and Eugene wouldn’t get his wish! But in moments the light began to fade and the silhouette of something MUCH smaller than a centaur lay curled in the fetal position as smoke curled off it’s form and that of the scorched…tile? Stone? Eugene was sure what the floor was made out of anymore. And then with another ominous rumble, the clouds overhead rolled away to whatever nebulous realm they had come from. Which was Olympus, obviously, but Eugene didn’t bother entertaining the preposterous idea any longer as Judy pushed past him, her coils releasing the greek geek from her clutches as she slithered towards what was left of Lindsey. Eugene tromped behind the massive snake, careful of his heavy strides to not accidentally step on the gorgon and once again set off her temper. So long as the monster would play nice, Eugene would as well.

There, curled into a tight ball of smoking fur, lay a half man-half...goat looking creature that had two large horns, the ugliest face Eugene had EVER seen (and he'd seen Judy's current one) and a long, but thin, penis that hung out hard and stiff from under a poorly fitting loincloth.. The new creature was also extremely small, it's two legs bent backwards and forwards and ending in two stubby cloven hooves. In fact Eugene wasn't sure if the creature's constant erection wasn't nearly as long as the animal man was tall.It's baby-like arms and tiny hands were clutching at five long connected tubes as it spasmed and twitched in the aftermath of the divine strike. A black card that read PENALTY lay attached to it's chest.

"What...What is that?" Eugene said, pointing at it with his sword. The creature groaned as it's wrinkly eyes fluttered.

"I think...I think Lindsssey jussst turned into a sssatyr..." Judy hissed as she slithered around her former friend. 'Ssso much for a tower guardian...' Part of her mind thought. Another part of her mind suggested that the satyr was small enough that she could probably eat it in a few bites, but Judy ignored both of them.

"That's Lindsey!?" Eugene gasped in surprise, "Pete, you..." Eugene's eyes stretched wider as he realized that Peter wasn't by his side, where he belonged. The hero spun on his sandaled heel and looked at the small crowd of handmaidens as they fan and massaged the oracle, who was groaning softly, a delicate hand on his forehead while her breasts hung out, open for the world to see. He felt a twinge of something but his concern overrode his 'hero' thoughts. "Peter, what...What happened!?"

Peri looked up with worry in her eyes, "Oh hero! When you were in the cave, our mistress was trying to show up how to dance! She called it 'The Shakira Thing" and said that maybe if we all started dancing, maybe the gods would help us with the 'party' she says we need to have!" Peri frittered about, making sure the other handmaidens were doing...Whatever they were doing right. Eugene really had no idea.

"So then the Pythia is dancing, doing the most magnificent moves when all of a sudden that ghastly, beastly centaur gets up and starts dancing with her! And drinking! He was so clumsy, and now he's paid the price!" The former security guard said with a girlish grunt of feminine approval.

"Yes, but WHAT happened, Peri? I saw the light-show, and Peter didn't sound like himself!" Eugene pointed up to the ceiling, "Where did those clouds come from1?"

"Why, Apollo of course! You see, sir hero, the centaur tripped and dumped all of his wine over our fair, pure mistress! And then he laughed like he did with Talia and grabbed Apollo's Grace! And he ripped off her robe! So then..."

"So then the blue smoke came out of the rock and I turned into Super-Bitch" Peter groaned as he pushed himself upright. "Ugh, my fucking head...Is that what it's like to have a god in your brain? I, uh, think I preferred it the other way" He chuckled, wincing at the headache that had descended up his skull. But he was extremely glad that Eugene was okay, and took a little solace in the fact that Eugene was now rushing to his side and worrying about him. He gave Eugene a smile as his tiny hand disappeared inside the titan's, "And hey, you brought the gorgon back! Wonder if we can roll again?"

Peter wasn't really sure what had happened, though. One moment he was staring in outrage as Lindsey paraded around with the remains of his top, and then the next moment it was like he could see EVERYTHING. And then something spoke THROUGH him...It was definitely different from last time, when it had just felt like a compulsion this had felt like a full override. Peter had just been a passenger in his own body. And he wasn't sure what to think about that. On the one hand, magic game...But...Apollo? In his head? Oy vey.

"I'm fine, by the way" A high pitched neighing voice said, and all eyes turned to focus on the tiny creature as it staggered to it's feet, seemingly permanent erection smacking painfully against the floor and showing in the tiny man's beady eyes.

"Ugh" Every other person in the still-transformed common room groaned in disgust. One of the handmaidens...Koren? The blonde one, seemed to throw up in her mouth a little.

"What? Whaaat!?" Lindsey said, arms splayed wide.

"Lindsssey, you're a sssatyr, honey" Judy rapsed, "Sssatyrsss are the dregsss of Dionysssusss'sss court. They make crude, crasssss jokes and have to live with, um, thossse" The gorgon seemed to be the only one in the room unaffected by Lindsey's new grotesque appearance, pointing at the awkward perma-boner that was sticking out of the loincloth.

"Huh? LIKE OMG!" Lindsey cried out, spotting the ungainly appendage for the first time, "First I get one big enough to kill someone and now it's all long and hard! Why!?"

"Because you apparently insulted the gods, specifically Apollo" Peter said, not making direct eye contact with the creature, "So do you guys think this means we don't have to have a party now? Judy, can you roll?"

"Uh, let me sssee..." Judy slithered over and grabbed her green and white dice, dropping it on the game map. It came to a stop and...

1112111111121111111.content:
The tiny plastic cube dropped from Judy's scaled, clawed hand and fell to the game table while the entire group (plus the gaggle of concerned and confused handmaidens that couldn't figure out why their mistress was not freaking out about the enormous gorgon or covering herself and instead intently focused on the strange device near the gorgon's cave) held their breath in anticipation. With any luck maybe Lindsey's drunken screw-up would have ended the Action Square's lockout and they could get on to playing and get to the wish at the end that much faster.

But the four players let out of a collective sigh of disappointment (for Lindsey it was more like a burp) as the die clicked and clattered across the table and the tiny figure that Judy had taken the shape of did not move.

"Damn! And it wassss a sssix too!" She hissed, resting her vicious looking hands on what amounted to her hips, where the human aspect of her body ended and the lengthy muscle mass of her snake attributes began.

"Looks like it's back to figuring out what a party was like in ancient Greece" Peter said, finally accepting a pillow to cover his breasts as he finally felt sturdy enough from the divine possession to sit upright without his pretty head throbbing. "Uh, thanks...uh..."

"Koren, oh most illustrious, most graceful, more beautiful vessel of Apollo's, um, greatness! A thousand blessings upon your most honorable-"

"Ugh, you're the one they keep telling to shut up, arn't you? Here's a tip girly, being a kiss-ass only gets you so far in life" Peter groaned as the perky blonde turned beet red and looked down at her feet, the rest of the handmaidens sharing small grins and even a quiet snicker. But they all went quiet save for a whimper from Talia as the gorgon slithered over.

"Actually we don't have to. In ancient Greece, partiesss were called sssymposssiumsss, and they involved a lot of drinking, eating but also danssscing and sssinging...And it wasss usssually ssscentered on a debate between two men, generally in posssitionsss of power. They'd make their ssspeechesss and then the gathered party-goersss would vote to ssseee who made the better pointsss" Judy said, doing her best to fight off the impulse to lunge at the whimpering girls.

"Wait, so you're telling me all those nerdy debate clubs started off as ragers?" Peter blinked in surprise.

"Yesss! Maybe if you'd lisssten to me onssssce in a while you'd actually learn ssssomething!" Judy stuck a forked tongue out at Peter, earning a wave of satisfying gasps of shock from the small harem, save for the one that seemed to be constantly carrying around the Omphalos.

"How dare you speak to the mistress that way, foul creature! She should call upon Apollo and have him smite you like she did the centaur!" Peri fumed, finding the courage within herself just as her mistress had with the centaur that her mistress, the bulky hero and the gorgon were all referring to as 'Lindsey' which seemed a very strange name and was now a foul little creature that was currently playing with it's disgusting privates...But Peri was beginning to realize that her mistress was more than a little unorthadox. Still radiant and wonderful, but definitely unorthadox. The transformed security guard placed two dainty hands on her hips and stared at the gorgon. If mistress could be brave, so could she!

"Yeesh, chill out Peri!" Peter said with a roll of his big brown eyes, reaching forward and pulling the feisty handmaiden back.

"But mistress-"

"It's fine she's, uh, okay with the gods. I think. Just chill out and uh, go get me an aspirin?" Peter rubbed his temples with his free hand, his words once again calming the gaggle of girls, but not completely setting them at ease like it had with Eugene. Probably because Judy was a monster and not a demigod ripped straight from all of Peter's fantasies.

"Ass per wren? Mistress, is this another outsider word?" Peri felt just AWFUL about letting her mistress down, but she kept using all these strange words and terms. She was doing her best but it was a base part of translating a foreign language to at least have some context of the words!

"Oh my gods are you kidding me? Over there in the kitchen there's a cabinet with a tiny blue...bottle...DUDE!" Peter exclaimed, pointing a finger towards what had once been the common room's kitchen. Instead of the broken fridge, a microwave and stove and sink was now a vast looking pantry filled with all sorts of foods from dried fruits, crisp looking vegetables all the way to various skinned animals hanging from hooks from the ceiling! Large pots that were filled with powdery looking stuff that was all manner of reds, yellows, oranges and browns, and even more capped pottery shaped like the ones Lindsey had been drinking from. There was even a small fountain filling a basin, the water pouring in from a gap in the wall that had NOT been there before the game had started.

"Oh wow" Judy gasped, as if seeing the complete changes to the common room for the first time. If only she could look out of something other than these snakes...But she pushed the notion aside as she felt a claw tease the edge of the blindfold.

"Oh, like, yeah! Where did you guys think I was getting all the wine and chicken from?" Lindsey cackled, but frowned as everyone seemed to ignore her. She sighed again and went back to trying to hide the skinny rod that was poking out from her, wincing from the pain as it bounced against the floor and was constantly throbbing.

'I should have gone back to Seattle and just dealt with that jerk' She thought darkly.

"Mistress...Should your temple NOT have a full pantry? Are your ways so different from that of Babylon's?" The exotic voice of Farah trilled. She questioned many of the things these foreigners did...But she still loved the divine Pythia. She doubted any other priestess of the gods would have pulled a Persian from the auction block.

"Wha?" Peter just blinked dumbly at the former Farad, "Oh wait, isn't that the place Xerxes was from in 300?"

Farah turned away in shame while a hiss of disapproval washed over the other handmaidens, typically involved the word 'fiend'.

"I...I am sorry I have made you utter such a cursed name, my mistress!" Farah said, falling to her knees. This was it, she was going to be kicked out! She would be put up for sale or worse! Greeks hated Persians and she wasn't safe without her mistress! "Please, forgive me! I shall..." Farah looked around before forcing herself to stare at the greasy satyr, "...Punish myself by laying with the satyr!"

"OMG!" Lindsey said, just happy that someone was paying attention to her again. She felt the narrow shower curtain hanging off her throb again.

"Ew! Uh, no it's fine. It's fine! I was just, uh, thinking out loud HEY LET'S GET THIS SIMP-POSER THING STARTED OKAY" The overwhelmed oracle just willed himself to ignore the headache and push the hideous mental picture of one of his handmaidens getting skewered by the little imp-thing.

"Hard to do, Peter. We have to have at least two guys, right? I'm the only dude here. Pretty sure THAT doesn't count" Eugene said, finally speaking up from his somewhat amused silence at watching Peter handle his 'squad'. It was actually amusingly charming to watch his oracle sputter about like a mother hen.

"Plusss we have to have a unbiasssed crowd to vote afterwardsss..."

"Well what are we going to do? If we can't end this dumbass party we'll never get to the end of the game and get that wish!"

"Well, uh..."

"MISTRESS!" Peri squealed loudly as a DELIGHTFUL idea popped into her head. She hopped around to face her wonderful Pythia, bowing low as she spoke quickly and excited, "I know where we can find another man! The boy from before! The one I distracted! And I'm sure he will know of others than would love to make a pilgrimage to your temple!"

"Who? You mean Jeremy?"

"YES!"

The demigod, gorgon and oracle looked at each other. The satyr looked as well but she was once again relegated to the background as part of her cursed appearance.

"Well...I guess it's a shot...But I really, really don't want to walk over there again. Does anyone have their Hermes Scroll? I think mine, uh, got Omphalos'd. Or something" Peter grumbled, lamenting the loss of the expensive device. He doubted he'd be able to get another one, not with the plague outside and Antikythera being so far away...

"Nope"

"I think we lossst whatever we had on usss when the game ssstarted"

"Oh, I have mine!" Lindsey offered, scrambling over to where the pile of pillows that had been a bean bag lay scattered. She dug around with her grubby hands before pulling out the small rectangular device that was powered by Zeus...Only to watch it POOF into a blank stone and chisel. She looked up at the others...Only to see they'd continued to ignore her, their discussion having drifted farther away.

"Well, Peri, since you offered...Do you know the way back to the house?" Eugene asked. He'd go himself but with the whole 'no English thing, the VERY eager handmaiden seemed the best choice for the job.

"Oh most definitely, great hero! I won't let my mistress down!" The perky former guard said, staring eagerly at her mistress.

"Well, uh, go and do my, uh will?" Peter said with a shrug and a wave, and then blinking as the girl sprinted away with a squeal of delight, moving as if she had been blessed by Hermes himself.

11122.content:
"Immersive sounds like VR." Eugene said.

"I don't think this system's quite capable of that..." He hefted the controller, as if his friends couldn't see this themselves. Using the joypad, Eugene moves the selection from 'traditional', to 'immersive', which dutifully started to flash. He'd half-hoped some VR effect, or early 3D would've appeared to show them the world they were about to enter.

"Ready?" he asked his friends, as he moved the controller down to 'start'. As the selection bar hovered over the 'Start Game' option on the control menu, Lindsay shrugged, "Well, ... if it's crap, we can just move on."

A tinny rendition of some John Williams march music started piping from the speakers.

Peter nodded for Eugene to go on, his focus already on the screen. Whatever the game he didn't like to lose. Lindsay was still as unenthusiastic as ever. Painting an insincere smile on her face, prepared to endure anything to spend time with her Peter.

Wondering if he was blowing any social cool he had, a glance to Judy saw her smiling too. A broad smile as wide and genuine as his own.

"Ready!" She answered, seeing his furtive glance. She gave a quick thumbs up, before returning both her hands to the controller.

"Immersive it is." Eugene said, listening for any hesitation amongst the loose knit group.

Thumbing the button, it gave an cheap, chiming tone, the music changed to deliver a brief crescendo.

- - - - -

It was at that point that Eugene discovered quite what 'immersive' truly meant. He yelped, as the controller seemed to sting him. Looking to his hands to see if it was a short-circuit, or a spark that had caused him the pain, he saw them.

They didn't look quite right. Oddly more pixelated, his eyes darted to his friends, or rather their hands. Each of them was looking to their hands in horror, as they started to shift from crude jiggling pixels to a finer resolution, then that turned to smoke, and was drawn towards the screen.

Lindsay started to shriek and freak-out. Her elbows jerking wildly as she tried to toss the controller aside. It remained stuck to her hands, even as they disappeared, even as the effect worked rapidly up her arms. All of them were freaking out, as the pixelation reached their bodies. Only Peter was holding his breath as if about to submerge beneath the water.

Judy was whimpering a quiet prayer to herself. While Eugene was trying to work out how this was a trick.

The machine was indifferent to their reactions. All of them, as their heads turned to smoke and shot towards the screen.

Four controllers, fell unobserved to the floor, as the screams turned into electronic noise before the room fell silent.
11122.title: "Immersive Mode?"

choices: "What about Uncharted, Lara Croft, or Relic Hunter?" Lindsay offered.
"Or we could make our own custom world?" Eugene suggested.
1113.content:
((Author's Note: My apologies to Mr. George for messing up the options with a small edit to the previous chapter))

"I remember the statues and temples from Greece. As a kid they were scary." Peter confessed. "I loved the stories of Gods amongst us, and all the creatures. I kinda wish we could go there, experience it."

Eugene was nodding along, "Yeah... Like the adventure of Ulysses, as he battled the Cyclops, or Circe the witch, that'd be a great adventure."

"That was actually Odysseus. Ulysses was his Roman-given name because the Romans just ripped off Greek mythology. But yeah, Greece sounds like fun." Judy interrupted, "But, the tales of Sheherazad, a woman telling stories so she was kept alive. I loved that one as a kid. To play in that world sounds like fun to me, with heroes like Aladdin or Sinbad, with his bare rippling chest, and they were gorgeous and hunky. A real Man, who'd win the princess, and leave the harem girls swooning."

"So...me then" Peter said with a grin, earning him a pillow to the face.

"Yeah, they all sound fun." Eugene tried to work the friends towards a common vision.

"So we want, fantasy creatures.... like Djinn, sorcerors, minotaurs and demons, harem girls, and heroic .. heroic heroes." he finished lamely, his voice trailing off.

"So..." Eugene started speaking again, his confidence coming back, as he read his friends faces.

"Where do we want to go?" he half-asked. As his friends looked from one face to another he continued.

"We could set it in Greece, the deserts of Arabia, in the jungles of Africa, tomb raiding, or on some other world..."

Sneaking in his own favourite as a compromise option. Eugene loved the Indiana Jones films... Well the first three, and was happy to compromise with a different world. His friends were more engaged with the idea nodding along, and compromising on each of the different features.

"So where do you think we should set it?" he asked.

"We should do Arabia, it's such an exotic place!" Judy said, already halfway into a daydream of her lounging about in a palace as an Arabian princess not unlike Jasmine from the live-action Aladdin, a Sultan's daughter caught up in a whirlwind adventure carrying her across a moonlit desert on a magic carpet.

"What? No! We should totally do Greece! I wanna kick someone off a cliff in that old 300 movie!" Pete said, "After all I'm part Spartan anyway. This is destiny at work here" The born-in-America athlete said, standing up from the couch and flexing his muscles in front of Judy.

"Ugh, gross" She said mockingly, rolling her eyes as she play-acted. But she did give Peter a small smirky grin as she snuck a peek at his butt.

"Yeah but we could also do something a little more modern? Like..." Lindsay said as he mind drifted towards more 'modern' fantasy adventures.

111321.title: They all wake up together somewhere else

112.content:
"Everyone knows about Star Wars, right?" Peter said after a moment of awkward silence, "This thing looks like it was made for that movie so let's just do that" In secret the football was more intrigued by sports, but he was currently the only sports enthusiast in the building, so he went with the suggestion that he figured would make the geeks happier.

"Oooh, good idea Pete!" Lindsey said, reaching up to shovel another handful of popcorn in her mouth.

"And here I thought I was only attracted to your muscles" Judy said with a grin.

And Eugene, well, Eugene was thrilled that they had picked his favorite topic to begin with.

"Okay, one sci-fi adventure coming right up!"

Slowly and carefully, the brown haired boy typed in the words 'SCIENCE FICTION' on the keypad, moving slowly and without much pressure lest the somewhat fragile text input device snapped. As he typed, the letters appeared in bright red on the tiny display screen, a multitude of small red lights forming the words. When he was done, Eugene pressed the 'ENTER' key on the keyboard and sat back to watch what would happen. The machine began to buzz and make several mechanical noises not unlike the sound a floppy disc would make as it was loaded into a old computer. The sound was harsh and metallic, and the group shared a look of concern with each other when the machine began screaming what sounded like an old dial-up Internet dial tone before suddenly, with a loud beep, all the noises stopped...And a latch opened on the sides of the machine's sloping dome, showing four hard plastic, primary colored game pieces: A astronaut, a alien and a retro styled robot and rocketship. And next to that flap, two big black buttons popped out of the side of the machine like two pieces of toast from a old toaster.

They were both about the size of a thumb and, in faded and flecked away white lettering, were labelled 'TRADITIONAL' and 'IMMERSIVE'.

"PLEASE CHOOSE A GAME MODE" The game's electronic voice buzzed again.

"Oh good, MORE choices, Peter groaned.

"Well, what do we want to do guys?" Eugene asked again, leaning forward and holding a finger over the buttons. Personally he sort of wanted to try Immersive mode, but again he wanted everyone to have a good time. It was why he had bought the game machine in the first place. There was only so much Internet and video games that someone could take in all this lockdown nonsense.

"Well, If we go 'traditional' then we'll probably have to, like, type in a bunch of stuff and wait for it to get printed out, right? I kinda want to see that" Lindsey said, resting her pretty, Legally Blonde face on her fist.

"I don't care, let's just do this already. You and Lindsey can just tell us what to do if we do the DnD one" Peter said, finally helping himself to a massive fist of popcorn.

After a round of discussion in which Peter largely tuned out because it was all nerdy talk, it was decided, the group would play their first game in...
112.title: Genre: Science Fiction

1121.content:
After another short discussion (and another slightly futile examination of the faded text on the game's box), the four friends decided that they'd try the 'Immersive' mode for their first run.

"Just go slow for me and Pete, okay? This stuff is new to us" Judy said as she leaned took the popcorn bowl back to the common room's kitchen area. She was slightly disappointed it had vanished so fast...But then again Peter's hands were large enough to be digging buckets on construction equipment. He'd practically emptied the bowl in two scoops.

"Yeah DnD is pretty easy to pick up. Maybe it'll print out character sheets or something? I've got some spares in my room I can grab if we need them" Eugene said as he pushed the big black button that had the word IMMERSIVE stenciled on it. The button slid back into the game machine with an audible click, and there was a whirring sound that emanated from within it.

"Oooh, that sounds like an old VHS tape!" Lindsey said as she marveled at the machine. It was, like, totes tripping all of her nerd buttons. She felt an urge to grab a screwdriver and take it apart like one of her computers and see all the old gizmos inside it...But she also didn't want to ruin Eugene's game.

"IMMERSIVE MODE SELECTED. PLEASE SELECT YOUR AVATAR AND ENTER THE WORD PLAYER AND NUMBER ON THE BACK INTO THE KEYPAD. TYPE START AND PRESS ENTER TO BEGIN THE GAME" The synthetic voice squelched, and the small tray holding the four game pieces slowly rose up until the astronaut, alien, robot and rocketship pieces were within easy reach of the four students.

"Well, who wants what?" Eugene asked, pointing to the figures, "I figure if this is like DnD then they might stats or something..."

"Dibs on the rocket!" Lindsey said, plucking the small yellow ship out of the machine with two sparkling bedazzled nails, "Um, guess I'm player 4" She said after looking on the back, holding it out to show Eugene who tried to be cool about the attention his crush was giving him. The rocket really was retro styled, it was a pointy dart-like shape that had three fine near a tiny engine, and even had two ray guns sticking out the front with three little rings around each sphere topped weapon. The only thing that looked a little out of place for the time period was the small bridge that poked out from the top of the ship and its row of little yellow windows.

"Why the rocket?" Judy called from the kitchen as she fixed herself a cup of tea.

"Cuz it's sooo retro!" Lindsey yelled back, "This whole thing is so totally retro and I love it!"

"Guess I'll take the alien" Peter said, leaning forward out of the couch and gingerly grabbing the tiny green, large foreheaded alien out of the tray. The jock looked at the number printed on the back of the alien, not really giving his chosen piece a detailed inspection, "Looks like I'm player 2 Geno"

"Judy, do you want the astronaut or the robot?" Eugene said as Judy rejoined the group, sipping on the glass of tea.

"I'll just take whatever one is left, its cool" The goth said as she readjusted her top.

"Well, if you're cool with being a robot then I'm gonna be the astronaut" Eugene reached forward and plucked the solid blue spacefarer from its cradle and inspected it. Much like the other game pieces, it was retro styled. The helmet was a bubble that linked directly into a collar of a poofy spacesuit that looked like it had been pulled out of a 1950s pulp comic. On the back of the astronaut was a white number 1.

"Looks like I'm player one" He said.

Yeah but are you like, um, ready?" Lindsey said, giggling at her own joke.

"Well, I guess that means I'm the automaton" Judy said as she set her glass of tea on the table and plucked the tiny robot out of its perch. She stared at it for a moment with her dark brown eyes, the egg-shaped head with antennas sticking out from the sides, hands that topped ribbed tube like arms that stuck out from the front of the robot and its large, blocky feet. "And by process of elimination, also means I'm player 3".

"All right. Give me a second..." Eugene bent over and carefully typed in the information for each of them into the game machine. Despite the somewhat tedious nature brought on by the game's analog and primitive interface, he couldn't help but be excited. How long had it been since this game had been played? He definitely hoped it wasn't a disappointment and a waste of fifteen bucks.

"Okay, here we go!" The geek said as he typed in the word START and with a little bit of dramatic flourish, pressed the enter key on the small keyboard...And frowned as nothing happened. There was just the same whirring noise from inside the machine.

"Did...did it work?" He said, looking around the machine for a newly revealed button or some indication that it was working.

"Maybe its busted" Peter said with a yawn.

"Just give it time to, like, think, okay? Old machines are old" Lindsey offered.

"I think my dad had something old like this when he was a kid. One of the old Nintendos. He said he had to blow on it to get the dust out or something" Judy said, taking another sip of her drink.

"Wish you would have made me a glass, babe" Peter said as he watched his girlfriend swallow a mouthful of the dark liquid.

"Well you didn't ask so bleh" She said, sticking a studded tongue out of her black lipstick colored lips.

The banter, however, was cut short as the machine emitted a deafening fanfare of digitized sound, and the four friends covered their ears.

"BEGINNING STAR QUEST. ALL PLAYERS ASSUME STARTING POSITIONS" The mechanical voice boomed on top of the pulpy soundtrack.

"SHIT! Turn it down Geno!" Peter roared over the emulated trumpets and strings.

"I can't, there's no volume button!"

"Guys is anyone else feeling kinda...dizzy?" Lindsey shouted, before her green eyes rolled up into her head and went limp in her beanbag.

"Lindsey! What happened to...her..." Eugene said, leaping from his seat before a wave of light headedness forced him back down. He cast a blurry look over at Peter and Judy, whose heads were lolling about as they slumped onto each other.

"Need to...turn off...game" Eugene muttered as the electronic anthem carried on, growing more muffled as a ringing filled Eugene's ears. He struggled to lift himself out of the chair, but the world spun and went black as he lost conciousness.

11211.content:
Cold, sharp air filled Eugene's nostrils as his mind slowly regained consciousness. He groaned and pulled himself upright as he blinked his blurry vision, bringing a hand up to his head...Only to grunt in surprise as it palmed a surface that was definitely NOT his head. Instead it was smooth and hard, and come to think of it, most of what Eugene could feel was a large amount of padding as if he was wearing a heavily insulated glove. The world finally swam into vision, and the first thing the young man saw was an arm at least twice the size of his own currently plastered to a wall of slightly reflective glass some inches away. It was like staring at the arm of a huge winter coat, and was covered in a blue suit that had white pinstriping and nodules. Eugene moved his left arm to wave, and the arm resting on the glassy surface waved.

"Oh. Oh no way!" Eugene said, his voice coming out out of a grill near the base of what he could only assume was his helmet, a harsh voice that wasn't his own. With some effort, Eugene rose to his feet and bent over and stared down at himself the best he could; the rest of his suit being the same blue as his arms and covered in straps, nodules and other doodads that looked like a mix between the astronaut suits of the early 1960s and something clearly designed for fiction.

"Dude!" He whispered. He..He was the astronaut!

Suddenly, a door to Eugene's right slide open as a tall, leggy, barely clothed woman stepped into the sparse chamber that Eugene had awoken in. It took the transformed student a moment to process that the creature he was looking at wasn't quite human, despite most of her body looking like that of a supermodel. Or a porn star. For starters, under the white and silver strips of what Eugene assumed to be cloth that barely covered her heaving breasts and hung off her wide hips and down over her crotch, her skin was entirely a shade pale green. Her face was mostly human, high cheekbones, puffy lips, a slightly upturned nose...But then the similarities stopped. Where the ears of a normal human would be were just two bony looking protrusions, sparkling silver chains hanging from each of them, and her wide black eyes that were filled with pinpricks of violet light, and her head was overall slightly swollen, her forehead riding up farther than what looked natural and two antennas stuck out prominently from her green flesh, topped with faintly glowing white orbs. Two tick...tails? Tendrils?...Tentacles? hung down off the back of her head and out from underneath a vibrant mane of hair that was rapidly shifting between bright red, white and blue.

"⊑⍜⌰⊬ ⌇⊑⟟⏁, ⍙⊑⍜ ⏃⍀⟒ ⊬⍜⎍!?" The clearly alien female said in a language Eugene couldn't possibly identify, her voice high and breathy as she leaned against the door, her exquisite legs turned inwards, knees knocking together as she was clearly struggling to walk in topless heels that looked almost comically impractical, revealing tiny two toed feet. Her sleeveless arms were thin and lacked anything that Eugene could identify as muscle mass. And both of her hands were tipped in fingers that looked just slightly too long and only had four fingers on each.

"What? I can't understand you!" Eugene said, taking a step back. Part of him was clearly turned on...But the sudden appearance of a real alien had taken him off guard.

Eugene couldn't help it. Despite his fear he raced forward as best as he could in the cumbersome suit and knelt next to her, a heavily gloved hand outstretched.

That, of course, was when the next visitor arrived, a seamless portion of a nearby wall sliding open and a retro-monstrosity clanking out, a clear glass head showing a multitude of spinning antennas, self-flipping switches, gauges and a Jacob's Ladder looking contraption that rose out of the mechanical mess, purple electricity constantly dancing upwards. It made a sound like an old fashioned calculator and began flailing it's stubby clamp-tipped arms about in a wild motion as it clomped forwards.

"THIS UNIT IS EXPRESSING SHOCK" The robot boomed, "UNIT WAS NOT EXPECTING THIS. UNIT DOES NOT LIKE THIS. UNIT WOULD LIKE TO RETURN TO PLACE OF MANUFACTURE" The robot's voice was deep and masculine and had a buzz at the end of each word. The mechanical being took another step forward before it stopped it's flailing approach, and brought it's primitive hands up to what Eugene could only assume was 'eye level'.

"I...wait...Judy!?" Eugene gasped in surprise. His eyes felt like they were about to pop out of his head, and he looked down at the sexy green alien woman that was pulling herself off the floor. "Oh god, PETER!?"

"Peter, if that's you, I can't understand what you're saying! You're speaking an alien language! Judy, can you translate what he's saying?" Eugene said, looking back and forth between his radically changed friends.

"Error. Error. Unit Judy is suffering from calibration errors. Unit Judy cannot translate without a translation matrix. Unit Judy desires to return to place of manufacture. Unit Judy does not enjoy this" The Judy-bot said, wiggling it's tube-like arms as if it was anxious.

"Yeah I'm...I'm sorry! I didn't know this would happen! Wait...Where are we? Where's...Where's Lindsey!?"

There was a squelch of static from above the door that the alien Eugene assumed was Peter entered through.

"I'm everywhere! Like I can see and feel and hear everything but I can't, like, move! I think I'm in space! Eugene, I think I turned into the rocketship!" Lindsey's voice crackled out through the speaker.

"Oh my god!" Eugene said, looking around him at the barren chamber in shock, and then out through the door which led down a rather empty, technicolor hallway that was lined with bright yellow pips, domed ceiling lights and doors that seemed to be random colors with no identification, "Lindsey, where...Where are we, how did we get here!?"

"We are currently orbiting Rigel-IV, captain" Lindsey's voice lost it's accent and inflection suddenly as she spoke in a monotone voice, "We arrived here on orders to meet the Jaxerion Warlord Nuk'ar and negotiate the release of Space Force hostages in return for saving his daughter, Solaria, who is currently in your custody"

"Lindsey?"

"Like OMG, that was SO weird! I suddenly just KNEW all this stuff that I didn't know before! It was like a switch in my brain flipped or something, it felt SUPER weird! Eugene, I don't think I like this!" Lindsey's bodyless voice said again, her natural way of speaking returning.

"I know this is...We're in the game!" The newly minted astronaut said as he lifted Peter to his uneasy feet.

"Query: Captain Eugene, can you get your current crew out?" Judy said, taking a thundering step forward.

Eugene shook his head, "I...You say the rules. That must have been what it meant about playing our characters. It also means that we..." Eugene looked down at his suited arms before grabbing one of Peter's arms and rolling it over as he gibbered in protest. There, on his hairless fore-arm, were five black bars.

"That must be our life count" Eugene said softly. He immediately regretted ever buying the game, this was just too dangerous, how could this even happen!? It was just a game!

"Umm Eugene? I think there's like, another ship or something getting close. I can, um, hear it? I think I might have like sonar or something" Lindsey said again.

"this must be level one. Well, I guess we have to start playing. Only way we get back to normal"

"This is SO weird"

"Unit Judy is not okay with this"

"⊑⟒⌰⌰⍜? ☊⏃⋏ ⊬⍜⎍ ⎍⋏⎅⟒⍀⌇⏁⏃⋏⎅ ⋔⟒!? ⏃⋏⎅ ⌰⟒⏁ ☌⍜ ⍜⎎ ⋔⊬ ⏃⍀⋔!"

With an uneasy glance at his friends, Eugene turned and marched down the hallway, Lindsey guiding the group to her bridge.

11211.title: STAR QUEST: Level 1

112112.content:
Eugene and his transformed friends had only made it partially up the single large corridor and ran the length of, well, another of his transformed friends and current crush when Lindsey's 'computer' voice spoke out over the series of speaker boxes that were located at the top of each otherwise blank door that led to a different compartment within her dart-shaped hull.

"Warning. Warning. Incoming attack. All hands brace for impact"

Which was immediately followed up by "OMG THEY'RE SHOOTING AT ME! HELP! AAAAAAAAHHHH!"

Moments later a violent, deafening crash rammed into the ship-into Lindsey's side and Eugene dramatically staggered back and forth before knocking his bulbous spherical helmet against the technicolor wall.

"⊑⍜⌰⊬ ⌇⊑⟟⏁! ⍙⊑⏃⏁ ⍙⏃⌇ ⏁⊑⏃⏁!?" Peter cried out as he FELL dramatically against Eugene, his knockout curves pushing against the teen turned astronaut's suit hard enough that Eugene could actually feel the curves. But the geek had little time to appreciate the feeling before another impact caused them both to go tumbling forward.

"Error. Error. Unit Judy cannot compute! Cannot compute!" The robot that had just minutes ago been a short stacked goth girl buzzed as her torso started a full 360 degree spin as the collection of antennas, diodes and other mechanical doodads began to glow dangerously red within her transparent eggshell head.. Her simplistic jointed legs tottered back and foot on top of the large bricks that were now her feet, and the metal clamps that replaced her once delicate hands dangerously flailed about inches from Peter and Eugene's faces.

"⏃⏃⏃⊑⊑⊑! ☍⟒⟒⌿ ⏁⊑⏃⏁ ☊⌰⏃⋏☍⟒⍀ ⏃⍙⏃⊬ ⎎⍀⍜⋔ ⋔⟒!" Peter squealed and buried his pretty face into Eugene's suit as his supermodel body shook with fear. Eugene's own face was filled with a carpet of multi-color hair that shifted across what had to be all different colors of the rainbow before then were suddenly bathed in harsh red lighting. Eugene pushed his changed friend off him, causing Peter to wobble and fall on his rather expansive butt with a angry sounding "⍜⍜⎎", but he ignored the jock's intelligible muttering to face Judy, who in her panicked state and the grim lighting looked more than a little terrifying.

'If she's left like this she's gonna explode or something!' Eugene thought as he looked at the bright, angry glow emanating from what had to be Judy's new 'brain'. He'd seen metal get that color before, in those 'will it melt' videos he watched on YouTube.

"Stop! You're gonna explode!" He cried out, but his malfunctioning robot simply continued to spin and flail, shouting out "ERROR. ERROR." In her booming masculine voice.

"Fuck. Uh..." Eugene searched his brain for a solution as Judy's own grew brighter and brighter, and he could see the glass shell begin to scorch internally. Maybe...maybe he had to give her a command? Like a real astronaut captain in whatever this 'Space Force' would do?"Uh, UNIT JUDY, COMMAND DIRECTIVE OVERRIDE! INITIATE COOLING!"

"COMMAND DIRECTIVE ACCEPTED. INITIATING COOL DOWN AND REPAIR" Judy boomed, her spinning body locking in place and a sharp screaming whistle began as a cloud of super-heated steam or gas or something spewed out from several different vent openings on her blocky body. Her arms went still and limp, and the glowing mass of metal that made up her new head began to cool as the electrical arcs between her pylons flickered out.

"Jesus" The intrepid astronaut rasped. He turned and stared up at the nearest speaker, "Lindsey, you okay?

"Warning. Warning. Structural integrity compromised. Hull strength at 42% and falling. Captain to the bridge. Captain to the bridge." Lindsey's 'ship' voice said calmly, which was instantly followed up by a loud cry of pain.

"OOOOOOWWW! I'VE BEEN, LIKE, SHOT! I WANNA GO HOME!" Lindsey said, her voice strained and wavering, "OH NO, THEY'RE COMING BACK! WE'RE GONNA DIE!"

"Oh, shit!. Pete, c'mon!" Eugene yelled, taking off down the corridor towards the large heavy door at the end of it.

Peter, since he currently lacked anyway of being understood or understanding anything the strange astronaut, the creepy looking robot and the other voice were saying, simply looked at the retreating suited figure before looking at the deactivated automaton behind him, and then grimacing at the two fleshy Mt. Everests that he'd woken up with, giving one a squeeze while brushing the constantly shifting hair that was EVERYWHERE out of his eyes.

"I should have told those nerds to shove it and just played some Madden. Where the fuck am I!? Who the hell was that!? Where the HELL are my THUMBS!?" He muttered, staring at his new hands in horror.

Meanwhile Eugene had finally reached the hatch that he assumed led to Lindsey's bridge. He spun the old fashioned crank latch until it unlocked with a heavy clunk and he pulled the door open with all of his strength, a creaking metallic grind ringing in his ears as it slowly swung open to reveal a room that looked like it had been ripped directly from the original Star Trek show, if only a little smaller.

In the middle was a single rectangular chair that floated in the middle of the bridge from what looked like thin...wires? There were two smaller chairs that were firmly secured to the floor just a little in front and below the central chair, two consoles of large blinking square lights and bulging screans that had the word 'WARNING' slowly flashing across them. The walls of the bridge were dotted with similar consoles, a sea of blinking toggles, switchboards, what looked like old fashioned computer servers with the giant tape reels, and on each side were three large circular portholes. Peter launched up off the rock and stormed around the edge of the crevice. He wasn't sure if he actually meant that he wanted to quit but the game really seemed to be against him at every turn.

"Peter, I don't think you should-" Eugene began, trying to not let his feelings get too hurt by the whiny jock.

"Geno, man I'm sorry, I just, I'm freaking out a little bit okay!?" Peter yelled back, not taking his eyes off the small rut he was making in the dirt with his pacing back and forth, "Just...I need to just think about all this for a minute"

"Maybe, like, give up two lives so we can just keep playing?" Lindsey, tapping her foot impatiently. Peter was her least favorite of the small friend group, and this little tantrum of his hadn't done her opinion of him any favors.

"No! Pete, honey, just...I'm coming over to get you, okay?" Judy said, moving towards the board. Her assistance was more than what Peter really deserved because of the way he was acting, but who knew what this game would do to him if he just sat there like a big baby?

'If I can just get him across without falling off myself we can just get on with the game and back to normal' The newly fit goth girl thought to herself as she put a foot out towards the board...

11421123.content:
The four players were starting at the chasm and at each other over the chasm, trying to figure out what to do next (Pete) or what to say to Pete (everyone else) when the following appeared over the chasm:

You're brand new to the game
That much is true
So I'm going to cut you a break
Here's a Mulligan for you!

The world started becoming blurry, then snapped back into focus.

Pete found himself with the other three looking at the board that had just materialized over the chasm. All four were back on the same side.

"Well, I guess we better start crossing," Lindsey said, and without hesitation, trotted across the board. Eugene and Judy followed suit, with both of them looking to have no problem with the crossing.

Why do I have a feeling I've done this before? Pete thought to himself. He hadn't, of course. At football practice, the thing he always had problem with were the foot placement drills. It was something he made himself to do extra, to get ready for the season. And now here he was, having to focus on foot placement and balance.

"Just one foot at a time," Pete told himself, as he began crossing the chasm. "Just one foot at time."

Pete

The group tries to work together to cross
114211232.content:
Pete inched across the board, scooting his feet inch by inch as he held his arms out straight, trying to mimic what his girlfriend, the bimbo and the nerd had done. He was already upset about having lost his chiseled physique, but something in the back of his mind darkly suggested that the other three would have probably been able to cross the board without this much trouble even if they hadn't had their bodies changed.

He was doing okay...Until he got to the middle where the board began to bow and bounce with every little movement and he struggled to stay upright.

'Just focus Pete, you...you got this! Just like when you danced around that kid and made the winning touch down Freshman year!' The athlete tried to psyche himself up, reliving the glorious memory where he actually HAD used fancy footwork to juke around the football field. It had proved his worth to the team and to his coach and instantly put his fears of not being good enough, of his scholarship being pulled, to rest.

"I got this" He hissed, and after taking a deep breath he calmed his nerves, fixed his eyes on the second half of the board...reached out with a foot and...

...Promptly missed his landing and fell, screaming, into the misty abyss below.

"PETER!" Judy cried as she scrambled towards the edge of the ravine, but Lindsey grabbed her and held her from suffering a similar fate as Peter's rather unmanly screams grew fainter and fainter until there was a loud CRUNCH and then silence.

Red text filled the air above the deadly crevice as the game spoke again.

You need to find your balance Pete!
You're slowing down the game!
Here let me help you out
With some better footing for your feet!

There was a distant chime in the air, and the silence was disrupted by screaming. Womanly screaming. The forest above shook and crashed as someone tall, lithe and thin landed on her ass. Her dark hair was tied in a loose braid, and her breasts were certainly filling out the blue latex jumpsuit she was wearing. Her legs were barely covered by a pair of booty shorts, and her feet were wrapped in stiletto heels. She couched once from the small cloud of dirt drifting lazily past her and then froze, her brown eyes wide as she slowly looked down at herself.

"OH MY GOD! I'M A FUCKING CHICK!" She screamed, flailing her arms in panic, not knowing how to handle the sudden jiggling her body was experiencing. The red text over the chasm faded as next words formed.

Welcome back to yet another try
I've helped you out you see
You should find the crossing now a snap
Now shut-up, go, be calm you ditz, don't you freaking cry

The woman suddenly calmed as light faded from her eyes. She looked at her body, clearly curious, but the panic was long gone replaced by...Well maybe by nothing as she began curling the end of the brain in her fingers. She eventually stopped staring down into her compressed cleavage and spotted her speechless friends on the other side of the gap, and her eyes brightened as she gave them a goofy wave.

"Like, OMG hey guys! Look at me! I'm TOTALLY like super hot now!"

"P-Peter!?" Judy gasped in horror.

"Heeey Jude! Like, best song EVER! But yeah it's totally me! But um, let's stop yelling! It's totally messing with my, um, voice thingy!" The woman rubbed her slender throat with a feminine hand and pulled herself upright with a girlish grunt, now several inches high than she had been in her normal body as she walked towards the board.

"Wait, Peter don't-" But Judy stopped in mid-scream as the girl that had been her boyfriend strutted across the board with no difficulty at all. IT barely even swayed or bowed under her long, confident stride, her enormous heels clipping and clopping one in front of the other, Peter looked pretty bored by the entire experience. And then she was on the other side of the chasm and towering over all of them.

"that was, like, super easy!" Peter giggled, striking a pose.

"Peter? How...But you- I don't-" Judy fumbled for words.

"You look like a stripper, Pete!" Lindsey couldn't help but giggle. But it wasn't her normal, air-headed giggle. It was a nervous giggle of someone realizing that maybe, just maybe, they were in over their heads.

"Yeah, and what's with...the..." Eugene was about to point out how Peter was acting, the polar opposite mannerisms and speech patterns, but the look his formerly male friend was giving him was pretty distracting.

"Oh heeeey Genie" Peter purred, walking away from Judy, her eyes fixed solely on the now last man standing, "This game is, like, really fun...Maybe whenever we get done we can play another...game?" Peter practically threw himself at Eugene, his new assets on display.

"Uh" Was all the geek could muster.

"No. No FUCKING way." Judy growled, "This is not happening. HEY GAME, WHAT THE FUCK GIVES!?" Judy screamed into the air.

After a moment the words appeared again.

Oh poor Judy, don't get be a bore
Your boyfriend was always a bit of a tripper
But not anymore, bring on the catwalks galore!
Now go on, lest he stay a stripper!

"No, this is...this is BULLSHIT! Change him back! Or I'll...I'll fucking smash you with a hammer when we get out of here!" Judy roared, giving the canopy of trees the finger.

That's so cute, a little threat
But onwards the game must go!
The next path you face, a challenging race
You better win before you get all wet!

"Like, too late, silly words!" Peter giggled, leaning heavily against Eugene, staring down at the clearly uncomfortable geek as Peter's ruby-tipped nails traced paths across his new muscles.

"Fucking kidding me?" Judy hissed, staring angrily at what had once been her boyfriend.

"Gross" Lindsey looked away from the scene in disgust.

But then there was a rush of wind, and a thick wall of fog closed in around the previous area, blocking out the chasm while the fog wall behind them fell away. In front of them, at the bottom of a steep, muddy slope, was an obstacle course made up of several different paths that hung low across a wide river that sat in front of a colossal, thundering waterfall. A massive mesh canopy soared above the course, sheltering most of it from the hot sun that was now directly overhead as the mist and fog curled away.

"Ooooh!" Peter gasped in simple amazement at the obstacle course.

There were rotting rope bridges, several having already collapsed partially or completely, leaving what looked like a series of parkour platforms hanging over the river. There were several enormous fallen trees green with moss but otherwise sturdy and straight, thick hanging vines and, sticking out of the rushing water, a multitude of rocks and boulders. On the far side of the river, up another muddy bank and anchored securely into a cliff-face, was a metal platform with a large red buzzer on it.

But before anyone could ask a question, the sky overhead darkened and there was a rumble of thunder, followed by large, heavy drops of rain that quickly turned into a full on downpour.

"Like, my hair!" Peter cried out in dismay as she clung to Eugene, who wanted to be exactly anywhere else but there.

"I...I think we gotta get over before the river floods!" He yelled over the downpour, pointing at the obstacle course, which was, thanks to the canopy, dry save for the spray of the clearly rising river, "I think the buzzer is the goal! We have to get there before the water takes out the paths!"

"Didn't the game say it was a race?" Lindsey yelled back, her soaked outfit clinging to her tightly.

"Yeah! So I guess whoever gets to...the buzzer first...wins?" Judy trailed off as the the three friends shared a concerned look.

"Like what are you silly bitches talking about?" Peter giggled despite having his hair, like, totally ruined.

There was another, louder crack of thunder directly overhead and the three competitors took off, sliding down the muddy embankment towards the course as the river continued to rise.

"HEY! LIKE, WAIT FOR ME!" Peter cried, strutting after them as fast as he could, and screaming as the soaked ground slid out from underneath him, sending his curvy form speeding down towards his friends in a mudslide.
114211232.title: falls into the chasm halfway across the board

1142112321.content:
Eugene did his best to slide down the muddy embankment to the small metal platform below, the obvious starting point for the obstacle course. But that still meant getting filthy and caked in slimy wet dirt that stuck to the bottom of his new climbing shoes.

"So much for looking hot" Eugene said, looking down at himself in dismay. But at least they were out of the sudden downpour of rain and under the massive tarp that stretched the length of the obstacle course. He stomped on the plain metal, dislodging as much of the mud as possible and otherwise cleaning off his gear..And then sneaking a peek at Judy and Lindsey, who were wiping the mud off their new forms with similar dismay.

'That's so hot' Eugene thought and tried not to be too obvious about staring...But then he didn't have to worry at all, as a high pitched, girly scream came from above where the woman that used to be Peter lost her footing and began messily sliding down the embankment...And bringing most of it with her as a mudslide began.

"Holy...RUN!" Eugene cried out to the two girls as he darted forward the first path he saw: The water-bound boulders that were slowly disappearing beneath the white-topped rushing water of the river. His rapid movement felt strange but also natural, most likely in part to the knowledge that had been bestowed to him by the game. He scampered across the stones, heading for a larger, more vertical rock that was clearly designed to test his new climbing ability.

The two girls blinked in confusion, turning to see what the newly fit geek was fleeing from...only to see the blue-clad Peter, his over-done angular face screeching in absolute terror as he flopped hard on the metal next to them, the rest of the bank close behind.

"AHHHHH!" Judy and Lindsey screamed in unison, and they turned towards their own respective paths, Lindsey racing for the vines and broken bridge platforms. The muddy haired girl carefully climbed on top of the metal landing's railing and pushed off, leaping onto a dangling vine and swinging across to the first of many different platforms that were hanging precariously in different states of disrepair. The soggy wood creaked as Lindsey lined herself for the short wall run she had to make next.

Judy herself eyed the deceptive safety of the more intact rope bridge and made her move towards it...only to look back at the muddy form of Peter, who was whimpering dumbly in the growing mud.

"Ugh GET UP YOU BIMBO!" Judy screamed, and wasted valuable seconds to pull Peter to his heeled feet and shove him towards the path made up of slippery long logs.

"But, like-" The jock turned stripper whined, but Judy was already gone, jumping over the rising mud and onto the rope bridge, which swung perilously from side to side as she started to make her way across. Judy grabbed both of the mossy, thick robes and began to take each step as quickly as she could as the bridge attempted to start barrel rolling...Or just fall apart entirely.

"Oh...Poop!" Peter cried with a petulant stamp of his muddy heel as he tip-toed (literally) out onto the first log, using his newfound (but hadn't he, like, always had it?) balance to stay upright despite the slick moss and his mud encrusted heels and body, "This is, like, the WORST vacation EVER!"
1142112321.title: The group attempts different paths on their own

choices: The group makes it farther on the second try.
Lindsey, Judy and Eugene continue to fail.
11421123212.content:
Despite the crumbling bank behind her and the dangerously fast and frothy water beneath her, Lindsey couldn't help but feel a thrilling rush as she stood on the swaying platform. Ahead of her was a trail of vines and collapsed bridge sections; some hung vertically, creating wall-like sections while others were flat like the one she stood on now and spaced between thick vines that hung down from above through slats in the tan-colored canopy. Here and there were metal bars that hung from thick chains and presented some form of swinging challenge. Some of the platforms rocked and bucked while others looked safe and still, and at the far end was a huge gap that was punctuated only by single rotten looking boards, vines and several rusty metal bars.

"This is just like those old Prince of Persia games!" The sorority girl thought to herself with a grin. She had always been good at those games, so that skill had to translate over to...whatever this was. It certainly felt like real life...But real life didn't work like this. But she had all these skills in her head now and this new body, so it couldn't be all that hard right?

She took a careful step back to give her just a little more space to get up to speed for the wall-run section ahead, took a couple of quick breaths and pushed herself forward, her muscled legs pumping as she raced across the section of collapsed bridge she was on. There was the ledge and...NOW! Lindsey leaped into the air, her body tilted at just enough of an angle to maintain momentum across the wall board....

...And she screamed as the board flipped end over end from her landing and she went crashing, hard, into the water below, bouncing off a barely visible rock with a loud "OOF!" before disappearing beneath the current. There was a chime as Lindsey fell from the sky and landed noisily on the muddied platform at the start of the obstacle course, a red 5 turning into a 4 appearing above her head.

"Damnit!" She cried, pulling herself through the (thankfully) slowing mud to start again.

_

Meanwhile Judy was making progress. She figured that she had the easiest path, after all outside of Peter's current...situation, her body didn't seem the same level of athletically inclined as Lindsey and Eugene were. All of her knowledge seemed more focused on general survivalism, and she wasn't sure how filtering the rushing water below into something safely drinkable would help her in this case. And she didn't see any sailboats or kayaks rushing down the rapidly flooding river, so she was stuck with traversing the long and rickety bridge.

Each step she took was slow and careful, testing the weight of each board as she moved forward. Some were sturdy enough to put her full weight on, many were dangerously soggy, but many of the boards were simply in such bad condition that they snapped with the slightest touch, dropping into the water below with a CRACK and a SPLOOSH. And each board lost, the bridge became more unstable, it's rocking more severe as it swung back and forth above the river, trying it's best to buck the goth off.

"You'll...have to try better...than that, game!" Judy sneered through the struggle of holding onto the moldy ropes as she neared the halfway point.

That was when the collapsing river bank behind her caused the bridge's supports to loosen, a sudden slack catching Judy off balance and she stumbled forward directly into a patch of weakened boards, all of which snapped and fell away underneath her body.

"OH COME O-" She howled as she tumbled into the rushing rapids, feeling the sting of the impact and the sound of water rushing up around her. Than the soaked goth was falling, landing knees first back on the starting platform, waist deep in the sucking mud.

"FUCK this game!" Judy hissed as she fought her way out of the mud, ignoring the live counter over her head as it subtracted a life, bringing her down to four. She stepped up to the even more rickety bridge and began her slow trek once more, the water now just a little bit closer and rising.

_

Eugene was having more luck than the others, the rocks he was clambering across gave him a height advantage from getting wet. He was moving like a fluid pro. First he'd practically skipped across the first few rocks, slippery as they may have been and landed safely on the first of six different shaped boulders that sat astride the river like large fat men taking a cleansing bath. The first boulder had been easy, the hand-holds apparent and obvious as he'd made his rock up it's vertical bulk to the flat top. The next rock seemed a little trickier, there were not as many hand-holds and they were spaced apart...And the only way to the top seemed to be a deep crack in the side. He'd have to use a carabiner to get to the top.

"Okay Geno" He said, calling himself the name that Peter calle-well, used to call him before the game transformed the jock into a brain-dead stripper. He risked a look at his transformed friend who was making his (or would it be her?) way slowly and steadily across the first fallen tree, wobbling every few steps and saying something that her couldn't hear because of the roar of the river.

"Well, Peter's moving so slow, so I can't rely on him. This is my fault, he's stuck like that because of me. We're all stuck here because of me! I'm the only guy left and I have EPIC muscles...I've gotta save us!" Eugene psyched himself up, allowing a macho feeling her very rarely felt fill him up as he gave the rock ahead a serious look. He gripped a fingerless gloved hand around one of the carabiners and with a wordless shout, took off running across the boulder he was on as fast as he could.

The heroic looking geek just didn't remember to take into account that rocks in rivers often had tiny divits and pools where water spray collected and were not perfect running tracks. Right as Eugene approached the edge, he splashed into a small puddle of clear water he hadn't seen, felt his ankle slip and twist under him, and the teen left loose a muffled "WHAAA?" as he tumbled over the edge of the boulder and impacted with a heavy thud near the bottom of the second, sticking just enough to the rock-face to realize he'd messed up before gravity peeled him off and dropped him unceremoniously into the water below.

A chime sounded and Eugene fell through the air, landing on the mudslide and sliding face-first into the collected mud on the platform below.

"BLEH!" He spat and looked above him to watch his life counter tick down one life. He spit out more of the cloying wet dirt and crawled over to the rocky starting point, looking on in despair as the river had almost covered the smaller stepping stones. He was running out of space! With a groan Eugene pulled himself up and began his trek once more across the drowned terrain.

_

And meanwhile, unnoticed by all of his other friends including that, like, dreamy hunk Eugene, Peter was continuing to make his way across, putting his cat-like balance to the test and just not looking down at the totally scary amount of water that was rushing past beneath the path of fallen trees. His breasts wibbled and wobbled, his ass jiggled to and fro, but Peter knew his body (despite having only been in it for a grand total of about fifteen minutes) and trusted his perfected stripper skills.

"I'm, like, totally gonna speak to the travel agency about this!" He muttered in his childish voice, trying not to scream as he felt the tree dipping lower as it's perch on the muddy bank grew softer and weaker. "I'm, gonna totally have someone, like, fired! I'm SUPER sure this isn't the way to the spa!"

Peter let loose a terrified squeak when he reached the second fallen tree that was lower and closer to the water, lodged in place against a craggy pile of boulder-ettes. It was SUPER slippery, and after a long moment of, like, deep thought while he rested his glorious rear on the edge of the fallen tree, Peter removed his heels and dropped carefully to the log below, his manicured and painted toes squishing in the slick layer of moss that had grown across the tree.

"Nooo, not my nails! UGH THIS IS SO GRODY!" Peter whined as he began making his way across the second log, ruined heels dangling from his tiny muddy hands.
11421123212.title: The group struggles to cross.

choices: The group reaches the far platform, and safety.
The group gets over-confident and fails again.
114211232121.content:
Lindsey jumped on the first vine on her chosen course and swung carefully back across to the first wooden platform, steadying herself as it swung lazily from side to side. The sport teen stood there for a moment, watching the wall section she had just tried to run across continue to sing back and forth, and she kicked herself for being so...well, dumb. Of COURSE it couldn't have worked, there was too much slack in the line and the section wasn't connected to anything! She should have read the terrain better before wasting one of her lives.

The concept of multiple lives was also something she wasn't trying to think too much on. If this had been real life and she'd done that...She would have been dead. A shiver not totally related to the cool air of the overhead storm or the wind racing through the river canyon crept down her back.

"Okay, focus Linds" She said to herself, "You still have to get a running start..."

Lindsey walked over and inspected the vertical sections of the ruined bridge and realized that there were several areas where, if she was careful, she could crawl along one before leaping to the other. Then she just had to make that fine up ahead to the next platform.

"Seems...simple enough" Lindsey said with a shrug. She moved back to the start position on her platform, took a deep breath...And sprinted forward, racing across the boards and with a mighty leap, reached out and...snagged her hand in one of the gaps!

"YES!" She screamed in exhilaration as she pulled the rest of her body up onto the section and with a excited giggle, began crawling across it towards the second section.

_

Judy struggled on the slippery wood, now having to climb up at a bit of an angle due to the new slack from the bridge's supports coming loose and having the added challenge of all the loose wood she had stepped on before being completely gone, leaving a haphazard path back to where she had fallen.

"First it takes my boyfriend, then it MURDERS me...fuck this game. I don't care if my body feels great, just...fuck this thing" Judy muttered as she leap-frogged from solid plank to solid plank, using engaging her core muscles as she launched herself back up the bridge.

The ropes twisted and turned from the rough action as the bridge began to violently swing from side to side, and Judy screamed in terror and frustration as it spun completely upside down as she approached the gaping hole where she'd lost her first life, her legs leaving the uncertain safety of the boards as she hung suspended over the river.

"NO! NO! NOT AGAIN!" Judy roared as she clung tightly to the ropes, her hands aching from the exertion as her knuckles turned white. She wasn't going to lose another life! She had to win...She had to get Peter back! After a moment terrified desperation, she began pulling herself upwards, redistributing her weight as she hooked a leg around one of the bridge's rope supports. She grunted again and swung her other leg up, securing herself in the ropes and from another plunge into the greedy white waters below.

"Y-yeah! TAKE THAT, ugh, GAME!" Judy screamed in primal fury. She carefully rotated herself upside down and began pulling herself along the upside down bridge, blinking water out of her eyes as she grinned like a mad woman at her progress (and the fact that even she had to admit, this felt pretty damn awesome like an action movie).

_

Eugene skipped along the disappearing path of smaller stones as carefully as he could, the rushing rapids of the river consuming his path forward far more quickly than the others due to their proximity to the water. Before they'd been a comfortable four or five feet above the water line, but the river was rising so rapidly that now they was being constantly splashed and soaked by the flood waters, making Eugene's trek quite risky as he nearly slipped twice on his return trip across.

"Fuck!" He swore as he pushed off the final stone and onto the first boulder, right as the rising tide swallowed the rock whole. He looked back and groaned with worry; the entire path was now GONE! He'd have to try one of the other paths if he wanted to cross the river...And outside of the three taken ones, the only path left was the rather risky looking two vines that he'd have to crawl back up the muddy embankment to get to...And then swing like hell and hoped he wasn't just mistaking environment detail for part of the actual competition.

But time for reflection was over as water lapped against his climbing shoes, and Eugene forced his new body to move as he clambered up the rock with less ease than he had before, given his soaked and doubly muddy clothes. But he made it once more to the top, swinging a leg over the lip of the boulder and pulling himself up with the leverage. He hung there for a moment however, feeling his muscles ripple and flex, expecting a burning pain...Yet all he felt was exhilarated energy.

"I wonder if this is what Pete always feels...felt like?" The normally overweight boy wondered, and then he pulled himself on top of the boulder and made his way, much more carefully this time, to the far lip and inspected the second of the three massive stones he had to cross. Running and jumping was out of the question, what with all the deceptive pitting (biopitting, his knew knowledge based warned him) that caused him to fail the first time. Now that he had taken the time, he spied a small grouping of potential handholds one the backside of his own boulder. They'd allow him to get a better, more secure base to leap across onto the second boulder, rather than his reckless movie star stunt that had ended in failure before.

"Strong, not dumb" Eugene mumbled to himself, reminding himself to not get overly reliant on his new body as he lowered himself down for a second traverse.

_

And Peter, poor Peter, was still inching her way across the second large log, squealing each time the log rocked was the water rushed against it, threatening to dislodge it from it's precarious perch on the disappearing rocks.

"Just, like, don't think about it girl!" She whispered to herself, keeping her eyes locked straight ahead, her legs mincing forward like she'd done a thousand times before at work. This was, ummm, this was like no different than her routine! Yeah! Just ignore all that totally super grody stuff squishing between her cute little toes and messing with her pedi!

The log rocked again, harder this time, and Peter screamed as she tilted dangerously from side to side, her assets threatening to lose their delicate balance. Her heels clopped together as she stuck her arms out trying to regain her balance and she felt the added weight of the mud-laden stilettos pulling her forward.

"WooAAAhhh!" She cried, and Peter gave her beloved heels a pouty look before she released them from her tiny hands, the heels dropping beneath the rising water with a PLOOP!

"Those were, like, my best pair! Like, I'm totally never coming here again!" Peter slowly regained her balance as the log shifted below her, tilting slightly upwards. The stripper took a nervous ragged breath, refocused on the log's horizon, and tried to play the music of her routine in her head as she moved towards the end of the log. Ahead of her were a collection of large flat stones that would take her up towards a shining metal pole.

"And I, like, know ALL about poles..." She thought airily, thinking of a certain pole she'd prefer to be looking at, stealing a glance over at the super hunky Eugene as he heroically leaped from one big rock thingy to the other like a total movie star.

One of her tiny feet started to lose traction, and Peter shook the errant thought from her mind as she looked away. She, like, didn't want to go swimming in some dumb river! She was pool-side only!

"Plus it would, like, totally ruin my hair" She pouted, already forgetting her black mane had been ruined on her tumble down the hill, now being filled with mud, twigs and properly soaked all the way through.
